Reviews.Title: “Good value apartment for three adults, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: LeedsRupert
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 days, excellent value. Good kitchen and bathroom. Sofabed ok although it was in the lounge. Bedroom v comfortable. We were on 21st floor and had amazing views - both in the dyatime and at night. The Davie area has plenty going on - 24 hr shops, good restauarnts. Also handy to walk to false Creek and get the ferry to Granville Island. We really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “a fully furnished 1 br apt in dwtn vancouver!!”
Reviews.Author: DGA69
Reviews.Content: & on top of that...the view!!! we stayed on the 20th floor city side so it wasn't too noisy. & the view was amazing! the sofa bed was a loveseat so a little small & the washer/dryer combo took forever & the clothes came out wrinkly. but...it was like our little home for 7 nights. thank you sandman for a great stay! :)

Reviews.Title: “Another very good stay”
Reviews.Author: jeffjsmith
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth or fifth stay at the Sandman Suites on Davie and we had a very enjoyable time again. The rooms are relatively small, especially the bathroom, but the compensation of excellent views and really helpful staff make up for that, and more. The rooms have well-equipped kitchens, and also a machine machine / dryer which makes our longer stays comfortable and give us more choice. It would be nice to have a better heater for the room since the fan in the unit is noisy. And a dustpan and brush would be a handy addition to the kitchen equipment. Other than that all seemed good to us. The staff are always very pleasant and do all they can to make your visit a pleasure. The local area suffered an expected and unusal power-outage for 6 hours and they did all they could to keep things going, and sent an apology to each room. It wasn't their fault, but they understood the inconvenience for the time that the power was out. The cleaning and maintenance staff are also to be commended for their friendliness and efficiency. The area is interesting and lively - all of life passes along Davie Street! It is very convenient (nice walking distance) for Downtown, English Bay and Granville Island, and has good bus links.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location, Great Rate!”
Reviews.Author: kimc1984
Reviews.Content: Just had a three night stay at Sandman suites.... although it was a bit noisy (I was there over St. Patty's weekend), the hotel was great. Room was very spacious and front desk staff were very helpful. I was given a complimentary upgrade with a wonderful view of the sea and mountains... Location was great. Easily walkable to many nearby attractions including Stanley Park, Canada Place, etc... Good selection of restaurants nearby including a great thai place across the street.. I was very happy with my stay and hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy heater..great location”
Reviews.Author: georgewilliam1
Reviews.Content: Great location and good kitchen....staff a little stiff and rest ...not good

Reviews.Title: “Here is a just off central hotel with great access to a wide variety of Restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: FCFireConsulting
Reviews.Content: If your standards are high and your budget is low then this is the hotel for you. I found this hotel way more than I expected for the price. If people watching and hussle and bussle is one of your likes - this is the place with a European feel. If you want a very quick stay and access to all major in out routes from either ferry to the island and want to enjoy good access to nightlife on your quick stay, you can find it here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable home away from home”
Reviews.Author: jessica P
Reviews.Content: The kitchen was nice to have, especially for someone with dietary concerns, though there was lots of different food options just downstairs including a fruit stand and Cobs breads. There was an in suite laundry, very helpful to have even if it was kind of annoying to use (locks for 10 minutes after cycle, 4 hr average cycle). The bedroom was small and the dresser in our room gave me a bruise on my hip from bumping into it so many times. If they put in flat screen tv's and got rid of the dresser it would free up lots of room. The bed was also uncomfortable, it was saggy and lumpy. But the views were excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Million dollar view and thoughtfully outfitted kitchens”
Reviews.Author: Elliott T
Reviews.Content: We stayed here five nights from January 7 to 11th while waiting to take possession of our new home. For a few days we wanted the convenience of a fully-outfitted suite complete with kitchen and laundry. We occupied a one bedroom king suite on the 20th floor. It came complete with four burner range, frost free refrigerator, a 24" dishwasher, microwave, and even a combination washer/condensing (ventless) dryer. Our suite had pots and pans, dishes, glasses, even things like measuring cups, knives, a strainer, potholders and a cutting board. They even supplied detergent for the dishwasher. The suite itself is nothing special furnishings wise, it was clean, the bath had minimal amenities and the furnishings were fairly ordinary. For us the luxury was in having a suite that we could cook and live in as though it were an apartment. As much as I enjoy eating out, after more than two weeks in hotel rooms we were delighted to be able to go the supermarket nearby and buy groceries that we could prepare ourselves. The view from all the windows and balcony was spectacular. We faced towards False Creek/English Bay and had a panoramic view of the entire area, including the residential building we were waiting to move into. A picture from the balcony is attached. We could watch freighters come and go, small pleasure craft navigating the bay, and even at night the view is magnificent because all the ships are lit up then. The suite included a washer/dryer combination unit. It sounds nifty but in reality it takes 5 hours or so to do one small load of laundry, most of that time being the drying cycle. It doesn't work like hot air dryers but instead it dehumidifies the clothes. They do come out warm and dry but rather more wrinkled than from a conventional dryer. We did two loads a day while we were there and by the time we checked out to take possession of our new home we left with suitcases full of clean clothing. We were offered a very good rate, some $40/night off the published rack rate but that saving was offset some by the fairly steep $18.25 daily parking rate. They told us it was $15 per day but on the bill was added a $3.25 parking tax, whatever that is. However it is in a secured underground lot. I had tremendous difficulty with the Internet wi-fi connection, with frustrating disconnections. My partner had less trouble but his computer is newer and I suspect has a better wi-fi receiver than mine. Nevertheless I had more trouble at this hotel than any of the others we'd recently stayed in en route to Vancouver. If you are considering a longer stay in the West End The Sandman Suites is a good choice. There are any number of hotels in the area with more posh amenities but very few that give you the luxury of living in what is essentially a completely outfitted one bedroom apartment.

Reviews.Title: “En-Suite 1BR with pull-out Sofa Bed is a gem”
Reviews.Author: Jos760
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I are looking for an en-suite 1BR hotel where one who snores would sleep in the bedroom and the one who doesn't would sleep on a pull-out bed. We couldn't afford separate rooms and so we googled around to find an en-suite BR just like Embassy Suites. Our priceline.com search populated this result and we called their local number and verified that all their rooms are en-suite BR with pull-out sofa bed on the living room. The rooms are exactly as they were in the pictures: up to date and clean. There is a kitchen complete with dishwasher, microwave, oven, washer-dryer combo unit, and pressing iron. There are even dishwashing liquid, utensils, and chinas provided. Even though I get to sleep in the pull-out sofa bed, there is a separate closet by the washer-dryer for me to store luggage and equipment, a surprise but a nice thought. The location is perfect. We didn't realize it's on the "rainbow" stretch of Davie Street, and that was perfectly fine but may be bothering for some bigots (we're strait and only in town for Whistler and Grouse skiing). There were good food around the corner: we ate Indian, Arabic, Mediterranean, Chinese and Filipino food. Pacific Place mall and Canada Place is a mile or a little more from this location but given the food we eat is considered an exercise. Parking is not free but not a rip-off either. However, because of lofty tax, it could cost you a lot as we drove from Seattle, crossed the border into Canada and stayed here for our ski vacation in Whistler, Grouse Mountain and side trip to Victoria and around Vancouver. We didn't have much interaction with staff except for the check-in and out and so we cannot gauge their friendliness beyond that.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly staff, & Enjoyable Week Stay”
Reviews.Author: Veronica T
Reviews.Content: I had escorted someone for 8 days, and I found the stay convenient, enjoyable, and awesome staff. I never had any problems during my stay but the only inconvenience was when we checked out, the taxis were shift changing and no one would take our request to airport. We almost missed our flight but it had nothing to do with the hotel per say.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovated, "cozy" suites”
Reviews.Author: gloabl
Reviews.Content: This sandman has undergone an amazing transformation with a modern renovation in in the recent past (not sure how long ago but looks fresh). The 18 story tower stands out as a beacon for travllers making the walking trek from high end Robson St shopping, though it doesnt look nice on the outside, the lobby is very modern, artsy and inviting. The hotel is in an ideal location for restauarants and urban lifestyle shops and services. The lobby of the hotel leads into a moxies bar, and steps away is starbucks, cobs bread, a farmers market, parisian bakery, jugo juice and anything you can imagine for lunch options. It is an easy walk to all the major attractions and shopping in vancouver and we had no issues getting meter parking for our visiting guests at any time. The hotel room has been modernized, however it was very tight. the bedroom, bathroom, living room was all crammed together efficiently but not really comfortably. With 6 family members visiting one night in our living room of the suite, it was stuffed full. This hotel makes a good choice for anyone who would like a full kitchen and fabulous view of the north shore mountains, city and ocean. Its location is perfect for shopping, dining and nightlife. i dont recommend this hotel for small kids due to the very high balconies overlooking the outdoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but a great view”
Reviews.Author: RainnIceberg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is much trendier in appearance than I had been expecting from a Sandman. The lobby is done with trendy lighting and was a pleasant surprise when I arrived. I had a room on the 22nd floor, and had really spectacular views of English bay, the mountains and the city. It's also nice that every room has a balcony. You can tell the rooms had been refurbished not too long ago, and had laminate flooring and a newer kitchenette in the living space. The living space was comfortable, but the bedroom was WAY too cramped for the King bed in it. Also, the bedding is in desperate need of replacement, with old coverlets and fleece comforters that most hotels have not used since the 90s. Additionally the mattress itself is in need of replacement. The cleanliness was fine with the exception of the mattress pad. It was stained so badly (and looked fairly fresh) that it was clearly visible through the linens. Revolting? Yes. Especially since it makes it appear as though the pads are not changed between guests. That being said, I asked the desk to ensure it was changed before I got back to my room, and it was. The staff seems to be friendly and helpful. Over all it's a good hotel to stay at, and not too expensive. It's a shame that the Hotel's food and beverage outlets only consist of a Moxie's restaurant, as I have never personally liked Moxie's, but there are lots of other restaurants in the area to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the Best Get Away Ever”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: I enjoy getting to this hotel. This past year I was fortunate enough to visit in March and August. When I called for reservations in August the hotel was nearly full. The young man at front desk took my reservation and then upgraded my room to a luxurious PH Suite.What a nice surprise. As usual the hotel staff exceeded my expectations to make my stay comfortable and pleasant. I love the location of this hotel. With in minutes I can be walking through Stanley Park or the Sea Wall...or convenient to a quick get away to Granville Island. I don't have to travel far to be at some of my most favourite restaurants. I would totally recommend this hotel if you are in Vancouver and want to be thrilled with excellent service and friendliness. Thanks again to the Duty Manager that upgraded my reservation....he went way beyond my expectations to make this one of my best memories of travel this year.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: BabySqueek
Reviews.Content: What an understated gem.We loved this spot and returned to it on our second trip to Vancouver. The value is just great, and even through I really tried to find a hotel offering the same value around the city - I couldn't. We had rooms on 18 floor and the views are just insane whether you are facing sunset or sunrise. It is great to have the little kitchenette, and the drugstore across, bakery and fruit shop up the street have enough to get you more than set up for a tasty breakfast. We did our own thing really, but any time we interacted with the staff we found them to be super friendly and helpful. For us the location was great. We enjoyed being able to walk anywhere around the city centre. Only the odd time we needed to get a taxi, but that was usually after over-indulging at dinner or at the end of nice long days sight-seeing. The rooms aren't giant, but the living area makes up for it. Anyway - who if you're on hols you'll be out and about loads.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the sandman”
Reviews.Author: CDNluvsMEX
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights while we were in vancouver for Doctor's appointments. To help save money we wanted a hotel suite with a kitchen. The room was big. It had a separate bedroom, living room, bath, and full kitchen. The only thing which was disappointing was the pool was an outside pool and closed for the season. You have to park around the back of the hotel which was a little awkward to begin with. There are allot of eating options such as Denny's, Indian, Asian, pizza, and pasta areas. Starbucks and Blenz are near by and a supermarket. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent high rise hotel in Vancouver's West End”
Reviews.Author: busanio
Reviews.Content: Kinda located this hotel by accident when traveling by the seat of my pants once. The room rate was not cheap, but what they provide is an apartment, with bedroom, full kitchen and fridge, washer and dryer, living room, TV, and a private balcony. The room we had overlooked English Bay and the view was spectacular at night. The hotel's lobby is modern and luxurious and the service was above average. The room was very clean, nice comfy bed, well furnished. The location, as can be said for all West End properties, is fantastic. There are loads of restaurants, shops, boutiques, grocery stores, and attractions within just a few minutes walk. I love the West End and try to explore different restaurants and things to do each time I go. If you can afford it, the Sandman Suites is a good choice. I don't know how the parking is as I took the train up from Seattle. Vancouver is a very walkable city and the public transport is great, so a car is not really needed.

Reviews.Title: “Sandman Suites on Davie”
Reviews.Author: Alan1766Spain
Reviews.Content: We have just spent three weeks at the above hotel. This is the second time that we have stayed there. I wrote a review last year praising them them for the quality of the apartment and also the service that we received whilst there. Twelve months later this has not changed and we can thoroughly recommend it The reception is first class and they are extremely willing to answer all your questions and queries.It is a good base to start your sightseeing of Vancouver and is centrally placed to easily get to all the visitor attractions. There are a large number of shops of all kinds on Davie Street and it is ideal for public transport. Well done Sandman.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central. Excellent option for Gay & Lesbian bars”
Reviews.Author: robmcchlery
Reviews.Content: Hotel has free WiFi. The suites are well equipped with a fully functional kitchen, even though the bedroom it self is a bit small. Lots of light. Washer Dryer in the room is great. Gym is well equipped and has a Steamroom attached. The Sofa bed us very comfortable. The hotel uses the attached Moxie's rtestaurant as its own, but there is a well stocked supermarket nearby and a fantastic bakery next door. G&L guests will enjoy the area. Pumpjack is across the street and there are many other bars and restaurants within a 2 block radius. Excellent for an extended stay as well as a short stay. Business travelleres will appreciate the working space as well as good private in suite space if you have to have to have a meeting.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Vancouver...Sandman Suites was a great choice!”
Reviews.Author: ccaterer
Reviews.Content: This is my first visit to Vancouver from Ontario. I used tripadvisor.ca to choose this hotel according to the area, price and included amenities. I have now stayed at the Sandman Suites for a couple of nights and am very pleased so far. The staff have been great and very helpful and accommodating. The hotel is central, the room is very clean and it certainly is a bonus having access to all the appliances (including an in-suite washer/dryer.) The only negative thing I have to say is that the in-room internet (at least in my room) sucks most of the time. I was a bit concerned about the neighbourhood before I arrived, but I soon realized it's not much different from other cities and i'm already becoming quite familiar with the area. I still have a couple of days before I have to leave Vancouver, however so far it has been a trip of a lifetime and my accommodations at Sandman have been very satisfactory!

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the dodgy credit card 'hold charge'”
Reviews.Author: Hospitalitywriter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Sandman on Davie for a few nights. It's a real mixed bag, so here are the pros and cons - Pros - great location, right near a 24 hour supermarket/pharmacy and plenty of terrific affordable restaurants. Lovely walk to Stanley Park and the beach. Having a washing machine and kitchen in the room/suit is brilliant too. The reception is also very stylish. Cons - Having seen the stylish reception, the very shabby, old fashioned rooms were a real disappointment (although the white goods were pretty new). The air con is one of those old boxes on the outside wall with a vent, which was practically useless, and the decor would have been old fashioned 15 years ago, with chipped furniture and very tired everything. But the WORST THING about this hotel was the fact that, without telling me, my credit card was charged $400 as a 'hold' when we checked in, and although I was told when we checked out that this would be refunded in 3 days, I ended up having to chase the hotel manager (who was VERY rude on email, saying that all North American hotels did this...well, having just stayed in 5 different hotel chains in America and Canada, the Sandman on Davie was the only one that a) didn't tell me, b) charged so much, and c) didn't automatically release the charge on checkout.) I also chased the hotel chain owner on Facebook, who did reply but didn't follow it up, and did not apologise for the rudeness of his hotel manager. I was finally refunded the money after more than 2 weeks, which is no fun when you're on holiday and need access to YOUR OWN MONEY. So, there are good points about this hotel (basically location and washing machine!), but make sure that you can afford an extra $400 on top of your spending money before you check into this hotel as you may have a fight on your hands to get the hold dropped from your card.

Reviews.Title: “If you value sleep - don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: stitchnthyme
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very loud, raucous area. Noisy traffic and lots of drunk people shouting in the streets (and in our hallway) kept us awake between the hours of 11:00pm-2:30am. Other than that the room was fine, but we will not stay here again due to the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Super stay”
Reviews.Author: djdaz1
Reviews.Content: We had a really good stay here while in Vancouver. The room (or suite!) was lovely nice amount of space good view from our blacony we stayed with our daughter who had a fold down sofa bed in the lounge - this did actually take a lot of room up - but was fine for us - the only minor problem was we were only given towels for two despite booking for three the area is in the middle of Vancouvers 'gay village' - it is also within walking area of the water and downtown We did find the carpark a little bit hard to find and get into Breakfast was served next door at the adjoining 'Moxie's Bar and Grill' It was basic but a fine start to the day We were there in the summer and our daughter really enjoyed the swimming pool which she had to herself All in all the stay was really good - the reception staff were very helpful and I would recommend this hotel to all

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but lots of minor problems.”
Reviews.Author: andrewf11
Reviews.Content: Good points: Good wifi Well-equipped rooms with an almost full kitchen Bad points: Poorly labelled parking, narrow and difficult underground parking Some disorganisation at front desk Slow and unreliable elevators Unreliable housekeeping - two days running room wasn't cleaned before 3pm Unreliable laundry - had to prompt them Hotel was excellent value, but obviously tired and needs a refresh.

Reviews.Title: “Check out the views!”
Reviews.Author: RicardoMartinez
Reviews.Content: Orange. Yep, orange - is the colour that greets you as you enter the lobby of the Sandman. Not what you expect, but it sort of works. The Sandman is a really good option in Vancouver for a few nights. It's a busy hotel and you can see that with the number of people always in and around reception and the lobby. On my visit, only two of the three lifts were in operation which resulted in a few log jams of people coming and going and 3-4 minutes waits up on our level. By the time I checked out, the third lift was back in operation, which helped with this issue massively We were given a room way up on level 22 - which is just superb with fantastic 180 degree views over the bay, and the mountains - and epic sunsets. The room was more of a small apartment style, with seperate bedroom (small). The living area too was quite small with only one sitting chair and not a sofa - so not really that good for two people. I did appreciate the kitchen with stove top, microwave, dishwasher, full size fridge and all the fixings. This apartment would be great for one person, even on a longer term rental - which may be their market as I overheard more than a few people discussing long term rates with reception. The place is clean and fairly modern, though you can tell it is an older building which has been refurbed into it's current spec. Someone suggested it was actually an apartment block that was turned into a hotel. I like the fact there is an ice machine on every other level so you can wander down and fill your ice bucket, or get a cold soft drink from a vending machine. There is a restaurant and cocktail bar downstairs although we didn't avail ourselves of this. A nearby supermarket was perfect for picking up some items to fix in the kitchen - basic breakfast essentials. And there is also a bottle shop (liquor store) right over the road if you want to pick up wines or beers (which you should, to enjoy out on the balcony at sunset!) The location of the hotel is slap bang in the middle of the Davie Street action. This is certainly the 'pink' part of Vancouver so be prepared for a gay vibe around this neighbourhood. It adds to the colour and atmosphere for sure - and you see and experience this in some of the nearby bars and cafes. Some other reviews had suggested this was seedy and their were a few creepy types in the neighbourhood. I didn't find this at all. The place feels quite safe and there are always people out and about. Reception staff were very efficient, super friendly and great for advice on local cafes and eateries. Thanks for the tip on Samurai Sushi - less than a block from the hotel. Wow - best value meal I ate the whole time I was in Vancouver. Massive portions of fresh sushi! Excellent bookshop down the street as well. You can walk to Granville Street easily from here and right into downtown. Can't fault the location, that's for sure. I enjoyed my couple of nights here. Highlights being the view from our room, convenient location, full kitchen scenario and friendly staff. No real downsides - the bathroom was a bit on the small side - but I didn't choose this place because of the bathroom. Free wireless was also appreciated. You can get a bus down the street to the train station (Canada Line) which will take you quickly and efficiently to the airport. It's too far to walk down to the station, unless you have minimal luggage. I actually got a cab down the street as I had a fair bit of luggage - price was about $8 down to the station. And about $3(?) through to the airport. Excellent system - sensible price for the train too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but...”
Reviews.Author: 189Anna
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in August. It has a good location, being central to all the attractions/sights of Downtown Vancouver. However, it is in an area where some 'alternative' shops and nightclubs are situated, so may not be the ideal location for the easily shocked/offended. The suite we were initially given was on the 6th floor and was very noisy as you could hear the air conditioning from the ground outside. The staff were able to move us to a higher floor where the noise wasn't quite so intrusive. I would say that was the only positive experience we had involving the staff of the hotel. On the whole, they were not particularly amiable or helpful. That said, the staff in Moxies (the bar/grill where breakfast was served) were very pleasant. The suite itself was average, although not particularly clean/well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “recommended”
Reviews.Author: jackie0911
Reviews.Content: I was there on 11-15 Sept2011. The room was spacious and well-equipped. Many good asian restaurants and supermarket were there at your walking distance. Free and fast wireless internet access. For me, the only con for this hotel was the dusty alarm clock on the bed side table!

Reviews.Title: “What sleep?”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: The staff and room facilities were very good, HOWEVER, we were subjected to never ending noise at night. We stayed on level 7 and I suspect that like for us, anywhere else below level 15 would hear individual cars driving Davie Street, the night life on Davie street, bangs and clatters in rooms one or two away. All of this with windows and doors closed. The position on Davie is great for tourism access, but bring your ear plugs. These is no effective sound proofing in this building.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Terry H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in Sept'11. Everything about the hotel is small; lobby, rooms, bathroom, elevator. I wouldn't consider that a bad thing, just a fact. Room was a clean and tidy suite. No cobwebs in the corners or dust bunnies that I could see. Nice little suite with bathroom with typical sink, toilet, shower/bath. Bedroom was mostly bed with about 2ft on left & right with a dresser with non-LCD TV balanced on top at the foot. Living room was a fold out couch (didn't use), desk area and kitchen counter/bar. Kitchen was fridge/freezer, stove, micro, coffee maker. Pots, plates, cups for 4 people in the cupboards. Had washer/dryer in the closet. Worked but took 4.5hrs for a couple of pants to wash/dry. Bed was comfortable. Reasonable pillows and blankets were soft, not scratchy like you sometimes find. AirConditioner is noisy but from the bedroom it was just white noise. Alternative was to open the balcony door and street noise was a little less (16th floor). Free Internet. Not cheap hotel restaurant (Moxies) but why bother with so much nearby. Room was "04" and was near elevators. Sitting in living room sounded like someone was constantly rolling their wheeled carry-on up and down the hall but it was the elevators. Not loud, just something you might notice and then could ignore. A nice, suitable, comfortable room in a very ideal location. Fact that it is a suite was just a bonus, allowing me to use the fridge and freezer. About 20 steps from any kind of restaurant you can imagine and pretty much central location to anything in north, south, east or west Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff, Terrible Rooms”
Reviews.Author: alisonb98
Reviews.Content: Our choice to book this hotel was based on the excellent reviews and the great photos online. We were crest-fallen when we actually walked into our room. It was tiny, with a depressingly small bathroom. The room was dusty, tired and smelled of cigarette smoke. We were then offered another room, which also smelled of cigarette smoke and the surfaces were dirty. The balcony was stained with mold. The third room was a little better than the previous two because it had a "wood" floor. The room felt like it hadn't been properly cleaned and smelled of the previous occupants. The bedspread, the carpet and the air conditioning unit were filthy. Rather than cancel and lose our money, we grudgingly accepted this room - at least there was no cigarette smell. Although the rooms were furnished as complete apartments with all appliances, everthing felt cheap and worn. The exterior of the building is depressing. The front desk clerk admitted that smoking in the rooms had been a problem. The elevators were very small and slow. The ceilings were low, the hallyways narrow. The whole building looked lke a converted apartment circa 1962. Street noise was excessive even from the 23rd floor! The staff however was extremely nice and helpful. They did their best to accomodate us. We won't be recommending this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: HarveyB2
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel. 10 minutes away by walking to downtown. A lots of restaurant on davie street at good price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location on Davies”
Reviews.Author: Richnj_11
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here last week and was actually quite pleased with the accomodations. Apparently, we were correct in getting an ocean view room as from what I hear, the street views aren't nearly as nice. Room was nicely updated but comforter on bed was very motelish.. Bathroom, although updated was quite tight.. Others were complaining about the wait for the elevators but we were pretty much okay, had to wait long only once. Nice bar and restaurant downstairs. Staff were okay, not overly friendly and they forgot to give us a tag to put in our car in the garage as we were given a "warning" notice on our car the next day. They said we never told them we had a car but yet we knew all the instrucitons on how and where to park, um, because they told us. So much for the customer always being right.. leason learned.. but overall, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jen18_10
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant at first to choose this hotel when I read a review that it was in the gayborhood part of the city. I thought it would be full of bars and sex shops. Fortunately for me, Hotels.com gave me a good deal at less than $100 dollars per night so I decided to give it a try. Plus points : (1) the hotel’s amenities: the one bedroom suite has everything on it (dishwasher, washer and dryer, oven, microwave, etc.). Internet (wired or wireless) is free of charge unlike other hotels and the signal was really, really good. (2) neighborhood: You can buy your groceries at a 24 hour store near the hotel or at two of organic shops nearby. You can choose to cook at your room or try out all the restaurants in the neighborhood. There are two Starbucks and Blenz Coffee next door if you just want to chill out. Minus points: elevator. There are three elevators. The one in the middle works fine. But the other two, although it works fine, has a faulty card reader. It usually takes some time for it to clear your card so you tend to spend some time swiping your card so you can punch in your hotel floor. If you are in a hurry, this can be irritable but otherwise, its fine. I hope the management will do something about the card reader of those two elevators. The hotel is in good neighborhood. The nearest train station (Yaletown) is eight blocks down the street. If you are coming from YVR airport, you can take the skytrain from there and it will cost you around $8.25 up to Yaletown-Roadhouse station. You can then take a taxi from the station or walk eight blocks up the street. If you have a big luggage, I suggest you take a taxi (probably cost you below $10) since it’s a little bit on the hilly side. Or you can take a taxi from the airport straight to the hotel. It will cost you around $35 including the customary tip. Location-wise, you will need to walk a minimum of five blocks before you reach any of the sites mentioned in tourist books. Robson street is the nearest at five blocks. The Aquabus ferry station is at the bottom of Davie street so you can also just walk to the end of Davie street and you will end up at the docking station of Aquabus that will take you to Granville Public Market. Or Burrard street, which is one block away from your hotel, you just turn left and walk all the way down that street and you will end up in Canada Place. I suggest you use google maps if you want to know how to get from this hotel to the sites you want to go to. It gives you a pretty accurate walking directions to the places you want to see. Vancouver downtown is a walking city. You can practically see all the tourist sites just using your map. Don’t forget to bring good pair of shoes so you can walk around and see the sights and not worry about blisters. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “No wonder its called the Sandman...you can't sleep in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: manhattantraveler24
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the Sandman over New Years and when I found this hotel on the website it looked amazing. The pictures made it look like the location was great and the hotel was huge. When i arrived i noticed was the picture they showed online was a whole nother building. The staff was fairly nice, the bed felt dirty and uncomfortable and the restaurant was not worth the expensive price.. If you want to enjoy Vancouver, do not stay at the Sandman hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay, with some room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: jeffjsmith
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice this year and so have had quite a time to evaluate the accommodation. The first time we stayed we had room on the city side on the 9th floor and were bothered by a noisy extractor above the kitchens. We pointed this out to the manager who has had it looked at, and although still not perfect it was much improved by our second visit. The room was reasonable otherwise, though maybe in need of redecorating. The bathroom is very compact. There was quite a lot of street noise late at night from the nearby bars. The rooms are adequately equipped for cooking - although a dustpan and brush would be handy. The towels were changed daily usually, despite our efforts to keep them sometimes. For the second stay we had a room on the sea/pool side which was much more attractive and quieter. Again the bathroom was small, but the suite was otherwise fine, with superb views to the sea and mountains. The elevators are slow and I am not sure they always respond immediately to a button press which makes things worse. So, if you are particularly impatient these might bother you a bit. We found all the staff very helpful, courteous and responsive. The breakfast was OK - basic but quite reasonable. The wifi internet was a bit unreliable and seemed to need a reset rather too often by the staff, but when it was working it was fine. All in all it was a good experience and we are very likely to return again on our next visit. Canadian Affair provided our booking on the second occasion and were efficient and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate at Best”
Reviews.Author: BruceGWood
Reviews.Content: The Sandman Suites on Davie in Vancouver was the place we stayed when we went to a wedding. The hotel did not have an entrance on Davie, so we had to go around to the back alley to get in. The neighborhood had some questionable peep show locations, and the streets were full of "ladies of the evening". The hotel itself had a great restaurant - on the young side - and the rooms were small. Advertising themselves as suites was quite surprising - two rooms that when put together could be one room in another hotel. We checked for bedbugs, but thankfully there were none. Although nothing bad happened during our stay, we would be hard pressed to return. The views from our balcony were wonderful of the Vancouver harbor, but that was its only saving grace.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for gay pride/fireworks”
Reviews.Author: corpkid
Reviews.Content: I traveled from Orlando, FL to meet friends from Calgary. We had booked a 1 BR suite for 5 nights, covering the Gay Pride events as well as the fireworks competition. We requested a King Suite facing the bay above the 20th floor. When I got there around 1pm and tried to secure our room, I was informed that we had a queen room facing the city. Luckily my friend had forwarded me his reservation and I showed the associate this on my phone. He seemed upset as the middle-man booking company "messed up another reservation". Either way, I told him I could not accept another type of room since there were 3 of us sharing the room. Long and short, he straightened it out (and it was very busy and hectic). It worked out fine in the end after 30 minutes of "drama." As for the hotel, it's pretty basic, but comfortable. The views are awesome. The location is awesome. Perfect place to spend pride, or enjoy the whole Davie experience. The fireworks were amazing from our balcony. Of course the elevators (3 of them) are a JOKE! It's painful how slow these things are. I'm not kidding - and neither are the other reviewers - you are in for a "treat" trying to move vertically in this building! Soooooooo slow! But that's about all I can complain about. We had a great stay and this is a great option if you want to stay in this part of town!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!!”
Reviews.Author: c33jay77
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Canadian Affair, they recommended this hotel in Vancouver. We did a bit of web research about the hotel and the reviews seemed OK. We arrived after a 9 hour flight and found the check in was easy. We got into our room and was pleasantly surprised that although it was small, there was a small kitchen, living room and separate bedroom. The bedroom was small and think that the whole room needed some new decoration. The bathroom was the bug bear of this hotel, you had to stand next to the toilet to close the door. Not much room either when you got out of the shower, this is the only issue that we had. We couldn't believe that the hotel was in the heart of the gay village and felt very safe. Moxies was also great for the complimentary breakfast. Can highly recommend the cocktails during the day/evening. The wait for the lift was rather boring at times, I do feel that there should have been more lifts to use.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suetoomer
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 3 times now, always for 3-4 days before flying home to London, plenty to do and see, good restaurants and a good central place in Vancouver, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A dump”
Reviews.Author: friendlyinsomniac
Reviews.Content: THis place is well past its prime. The lobby is renovated but upstairs it is run down. The elevators are unreliable and there is no service elevator so the housekeepers or room service deliveries can occupy and entire car - after you have waited 10 minutes for an elevator to show up. When i showed up the hotel had no record of my reservation even though I produced a confirmation letter sent by Sandman. They were able to work me in but not without hassle of waiting in line twice. Front desk always has a line by the way. The room itself was awful. The kitchen area was renovated, beautiful, but the living area, bedroom and bathroom are very worn. Extremely uncomfortable bed. Lots of noise from the street, noise from adjoining rooms and elevator noise. Air Conditioning unit is in the living room, you have to leave it very cold for an extended period of time to get any of that circulation into the stuffy bedroom. Also if you were expecting space with the suite you won't get it. Though the rooms are 1-bedroom apartment type units, the space is tight. It is like a regular hotel room that has been divided up into tight spaces. Did I mention the elevator is a death trap? They are not good about providing towells and what they do provide never dries out because the bathrooms have no ventilation, so always damp. The parking garage is very difficult to locate, impossible to get the gate open, spaces are tight (you will get dinged!) and the elevator ride up from the parking area is even more aggravating then the regular death trap elevator. Pass on this one. Next time will try the Sunset Inn one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, mediocre room”
Reviews.Author: PujaLondon
Reviews.Content: I arrived a day after my friends, but checking in was a nightmare for them, since the reservation was under the wrong name - through the fault of the central reservation service - but my friends were made to feel it was their fault! After I arrived from a 10 hour flight, we asked for extra towels and when housekeeping came to deliver them, we asked him to make my sofabed, but he brushed us off by saying the pillows and linen were in the closet. When we specifically asked him to make it for us, he said he'd send someone. 25 minutes later and nothing. I called down to enquire and was put on hold for an unacceptable length of time, so we ended up making the bed ourselves. Our room overlooks Davie Street and it isn't soundproof. The noise of people, sirens, music and traffic is so loud that you need earplugs. And parking is an additional $20 per day! The location is ok, but I wouldn't stay here again, primarily because of the standard of service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: BowlsTom
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Sandman on Davie a couple of times and love it. It's in a great location on Davie Street which has lots of cafes and bars. Easy walk through some residential area to Robson Street as well as being close to Granville Street and English Bay. I had a Standard Room I think which had a full kitchen and a big balcony overlooking the ocean. Furnishing isn't super flash but is still tidy and nothing wrong with it. Sounds like there's a refurb on the way anyway so that will do well for the place. There's a Moxies underneath the hotel as well which is always a safe bet for good food. Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENCE AT IT'S FINEST!!!”
Reviews.Author: RichardBNE
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sandman Suites on Davie for one night and all I can say is that hotel reignited my idea of luxury! For the price I paid, it was well worth it. It's location is right in the heart of downtown with ample access to all amenities - cafes, restaurants, fast food etc. The service was outstanding!! Felt really welcomed and concierge was amazingly helpful to a new immigrant! I couldn't praise the service enough! The room I stayed in was absolutely beautiful! Balcony was spacious. Room was a little small but nothing uninhabitable. Overall, a wonderful stay and would absolutely stay again in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely welcome after long haul flight”
Reviews.Author: DublinJoanne
Reviews.Content: had a wonderful stay before and after cruise. gave us early check in with fab views. grt wit family room, kitchen+washer dryer a gift after the cruise. the staff very helpful and the complimentary breakfast a gift. home from home.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable jumping off spot for day trips.”
Reviews.Author: Cousinkk
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the stay here. Near restaurants, bake shop, fruit and produce store. Easy walk to Engish Bay and Stanley Park. Accommodation were not overly huge by any means, but were comfortable. Found the kitchenette well equipped and quite handy to have. I would use this Hotel again unless there was a large increase in rates.

Reviews.Title: “Celebrating our anniversary”
Reviews.Author: 2Tails
Reviews.Content: We went back to Vancouver on the 5th anniversary of our wedding. We wanted to stay in the center of the gay district so the Sandman was our choice because everything we wanted (bars, restaurants, and spas) was in walking distance. We loved the hotel! Yes, the rooms are small and the elevator slow but location, location, location made up for it! The rooms are comfortable, clean, and convenient and where else do you get a kitchen and washer/dryer for the money? We will definitely return there on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Commz
Reviews.Content: Booked this place following reviewing Booking.com. The attraction was two fold, location and a suite. Despite arriving early our suite was available and we were very quickly checked in. The staff at Reception was really helpful and their local knowledge was amazing. We were given information about the forthcoming Pride events, local maps and info on the locality including where to avoid at night!! The Suite was well appointed and on the 21st floor with excellent views of the bay and mountains. Given Vancouver was the culmination of our touring the facilities were great to have, very relaxing, TV, air con, kitchen (under utilised!!) which was serviced daily. The whole establishment was clean & tidy. Moxie's Bar was part of the Hotel, and took a drink there each afternoon and evening. It was very lively and friendly especially when Jonathon was around who was a real live wire with excellent attention to detail and run a really tight bar. No matter what we approached the Reception Staff with; it was sorted from directions, to Whale Watching, Open Bus Tours to travel to the airport. Their professionalism was exemplar and clearly dedicated to ensuring guests were well taken care of. Maintenance and housekeeping was no different, polite, courteous and friendly. The Management culture seems to be a really good one and I imagine staff must enjoy working there. I would not hesitate to book here again which is always an acid test!

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad and the Ugly...”
Reviews.Author: purelydigital1010
Reviews.Content: Furniture is from early eighties, all scuffed up and similar to crap left at side of the road. OK if there is some room discount but we are talking 200$?+ rooms. Elevator takes along time but kinda appreciate the security which is excellent. Windows are sealed shut which was awful for lack of air flow and the fact we tried to cook food and the fire alarm constantly went off. I wanted to leave door open and just let it wail away but my wife wouldn't let me. No dish soap, no paper towels..(200$?). Wicked location. OMG You couldn't get better. Walk out the front door and there are so many directions that rock. View was great at the 21st floor, Oh, and when we arrived...they had booked us a room that was without a pull-out for daughter though we clearly booked one. Yes, and the TV's were both 28 inch old fashioned one with crap picture. Advetisement said pool open till 11 PM., nope...9 PM.

Reviews.Title: “Need room card to ascend in the lift”
Reviews.Author: nectarine
Reviews.Content: Hotel was central, clean and tidy, we was not told that you had to place your room card in a slot in the lift to go up to your floor, so spent nearly 10 minutes in one lift trying to get it to go up!!! good security but they should inform the guests!! The room was reasonable, kitchen even had a washing machine, balcony had a good view but sent me dizzy as I dont like heights, the view down was of the outdoor swimming pool, but straight ahead was English Bay, bedroom was just big enough for the one double bed and the bathroom was quite small but adequate. Breakfast was free at the bar next to hotel, Moxy's and wasnt too bad, service was a bit hit and miss.

Reviews.Title: “Small one bedroom”
Reviews.Author: BackporchBob
Reviews.Content: Hotel was decent enough, trendy lobby area. One bedroom suite was quite small, tiny little bathroom that steamed up pretty nicely after shower. Made a mistake of using the built-in clothes washer/dryer....never did get the clothes dry, had to leave with damp clothes in plastic bags. Decent $20 parking rate.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Vancouver! :)”
Reviews.Author: artsysimone
Reviews.Content: The airline I worked for sometimes uses Sandman for flight crew layovers, and since my experience in their other hotels have always been outstanding, my boyfriend and I gave the Sandman on Davie Street a try for the first time in March of 2010, again in the summer of 2010 and then again in January 2011. I was a flight attendant at the time and have stayed at a lot of high-end hotels and a lot of dives. I'm pretty discerning when it comes to customer service and know how hotel guests are supposed to be treated. First off, I will say that although I'm pretty easy to please and don't like to be a bother to hotel staff, my boyfriend is kind of high-maintenance (he's a pilot, so...yeah). LOL! He has allergies, he prefers the suites with hardwood floors and he doesn't like a lot of noise (he's a light sleeper). He is a compulsive room-changer if anything is amiss. Front desk staff were not only tolerant, but they were friendly and accommodating when my boyfriend politely requested room changes - twice - on our last two visits. All staff we encountered were polite, efficient, professional, helpful and informative. Each time we've stayed they've honoured our airline employee corporate rate. During our first stay, we had a room on the 21st floor (2102 or 2103 I believe - harbour view corner suite closest to Davie Street, facing west, same side of the hall as the elevators). We were absolutely wowed by the hardwood floors in the kitchen and living area, the huge balcony, the stunning harbour view, the full kitchen complete with stainless steel appliances, dishes and a washer/dryer, and a queen-sized bed. We had absolutely no problems during our first stay. Yes, the bathroom is small, but are you planning on sleeping in the bathroom? Are you spending the majority of your stay in the bathroom? If so, then you have a bigger problem in life than a hotel room with a small bathroom. LOL! It's roomy enough for one person, a little tight, but I've had rooms in other hotels with smaller bathrooms, and besides, the rest of the hotel room more than made up for it. Being able to do our laundry, make our own breakfast each morning and having a fridge to put goodies in was a wonderful convenience. Parking rates were a little steep, but that's downtown Vancouver, and considering it's secure underground parking, we felt good about having a safe place to park. In all honesty, you don't need a car for most of your stay if you plan on staying at this location, as everything cool in downtown Vancouver is within walking distance. Street noise wasn't that bad at all, quite surprising considering how busy it is in this area. Housekeeping staff were always friendly and nice, and allowed me to take extra shampoo (I have long hair). We kept our laptops and other valuables in our rooms on each stay and felt confident enough in the staff's integrity to leave them in our room when we went out. The wireless internet connection in the hotel is a little janky, cutting out unexpectedly on one of our stays, but most of the time it was alright (we were there to enjoy the city, not the internet, so it wasn't that big of a deal to us). Also, if you plan on making local calls, they charge about $0.99 per call. I think that's about the only thing I didn't like about this hotel - it's a little thing, but when you're paying the standard nightly room rate, it kind of sucks to be nickeled and dimed for local calls (which I think should be free). Most hotels do this, and I think it's a cheap money-grab that tarnishes the experience somewhat. It would be nice to see the Sandman break from the herd in this regard. My boyfriend complained (nicely) about the phone charges, and front desk staff took it off right away without an argument. For those of you wondering about bed bugs - on all three stays, we had absolutely NO bed bug bites, nor were there any sign of bed bugs, and I've never had a single bite at any of Sandman's hotels we've stayed in (we've stayed at the Sandman in Richmond and Revelstoke as well and have never had a problem). The wait for elevators at this location is a slight annoyance during peak check-in and check-out times (or if there are teams staying at the hotel), but most of the time it's not bad at all. You need to use your room key at night to access your floor (a nice security feature, but a pain if you forget or you're not fast enough and end up going for an unwanted ride. LOL!) During our second stay, we were given a corner room - it was either the 12th floor, 13th floor or the 10th floor, I can't remember. The room was a corner suite with a harbour view (same side of the hall as our previous room and elevators, but on the south/alley side of the building). The suite had carpet rather than hardwood, was somewhat smaller than its it's other corner counterpart and had considerably more wind noise than our prior suite. My boyfriend experienced allergy symptoms and we found out this was a floor that allowed pets, so we asked to move. We looked at a corner room (on the north side of the building) a few floors up, which also had carpet (we thought all suites had hardwood like our first suite, but hardwood suites are only on the 21st floor and above, if I'm remembering correctly). They didn't have a harbour view suite above the 21st floor available, so they showed us a room on the 23rd floor opposite the elevator. We were a little skeptical, but the room was beautiful and you couldn't hear the elevator at all, and the view of downtown Vancouver was stunning, so we took it. We experienced no further issues. On our third stay, we were given a room on the 23rd floor (as we requested, as my boyfriend has minimal allergy symptoms in the hardwood suites) with a city view. It wasn't a corner suite, but I find the non-corner suites quite roomy on the city-side (we viewed a non-corner suite on the harbour-view side on a previous stay and though I loved it, my boyfriend prefers the layout of the inner suites on the east-facing city side). Again, staff was tolerant of his apologetic room-moving requests (more tolerant than even me. LOL!) and once we settled into a suite that he was happy with, there were no further issues. I've read some reviews saying that this hotel is in a ghetto location, and I completely disagree. It's in an excellent location, within walking distance of street-level shops and a surprising diversity of restaurants - within a block of the Sandman, there are two indian restaurants (the one on the same side of the road as the Sandman is fantastic), two mexican restaurants, a thai restaurant (delicious soup), three greek restaurants, a burger joint, two chinese restaurants, a Starbucks, and for those of you with more vanilla tastes, a Denny's. Moxie's (the hotel restaurant) is ALWAYS great (the Beef Vindaloo is my favourite, as well as the BBQ pork ribs with garlic mashed potatoes. The burgers are always great, and their eggs benny for breakfast is outstanding). It's within walking distance of lots of cool and eclectic street-level shops, and for those of you who like to party in your hotel rooms and make the lives of everyone around you a sleepless hell, there's a liquor store one block away. There are also two small grocery stores with fresh fruit stands and a Mac's store (chain convenience store). Honestly, if the Sandman ever converted to condos, it would be an ideal location to live. It's just up the hill from the ferry that takes you to Granville Island, it's about a 20 minute walk to Stanley Park and about a 10 minute walk to Robson Street. It couldn't be in a more ideal location in my opinion. It's a wonderful area, diverse, dynamic and buzzing with activity, and it's probably my favourite area of Vancouver. My boyfriend and I travel a lot and have stayed at a vast array of hotels throughout Canada and North America, and I have to say that the Sandman on Davie Street is, by far, one of our favourite hotels to stay in (and we've stayed at Starwood hotels, Marriott hotels - and we prefer Sandman, because the company is big enough to care about quality but isn't so big that they're arrogant and don't care about customers). I recommend rooms on the 21st floor or above (the ones with hardwood in the kitchen and living space) for those people with allergy concerns (or people who just like having a prettier room. LOL!), and I recommend corner rooms on the north corner of the hotel (closest to Davie Street) or central rooms that aren't on the elevator side if you want to minimize wind and elevator noise. As a side note, my boyfriend's sister stayed at the Sheraton Vancouver Wall Centre during our most recent visit in January 2011, and after leaving their room my boyfriend and I commented that we liked our Sandman room much better than the Sheraton, because of the location and in-room conveniences (and room rates at the Sheraton were double the cost of Sandman rates). If you're looking for a home-away from home with all the conveniences of home (in-suite laundry, a dishwasher, full-sized refrigerator, microwave, full dish set and cutlery, a toaster, a kettle and a coffee maker) in a great location, I highly recommend this hotel. :)

Reviews.Title: “It's all about Davie Street!”
Reviews.Author: MellieEdmonton
Reviews.Content: 3 of us stayed at the Sandman Suites and we had a blast! The room was huge and there was even a washer and dryer in the room. The location is fantastic. Any food that you can think of you will find within a 5 block radius on Davie street. We felt safe on Davie no matter what time it was and you are so close to Robson and all other areas. I can't remember her name but Elizabeth or maybe Alyssa??? was so helpful always giving us directions and suggestions on were to go, we really appreciated it as it was our first time in Vancouver. Book this hotel the value is great and the location is fantastic!!! We are already talking about going back soon. Just so you know Davie Street is where the Gay village is in Vancouver. So if you are arrogant, rude, and think you are above all other walks of life then this location is not for you and you do not deserve to stay here! Thanks Sandman!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation and service”
Reviews.Author: jjamccro
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for 4 nights to see the sights of Vancouver and were glad we booked this hotel. The suite of rooms had everything we wanted including a fully functional kitchenette and washing machine. The size of the rooms were perfectly acceptable and we over looked the heated outside swimming pool (8ft max depth). Unexpectedly, we were given breakfast vouchers for each day which was a nice touch and all staff we had contact with were polite and friendly. A leaking iron we reported was replaced almost immediately. As our taxi was not due to 2pm on our last day, the hotel allowed us to check out later then normal and this was really appreciated. The area is not too far from all the shops or beach area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location.”
Reviews.Author: SoCalGal46
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights and found this to be a good base for exploring the city. The desk staff were extremely helpful. The room was basic but clean and we liked the full kitchen. Our experience in the restaurant next door was really different from other reviewers', since our orange juice came right on time and we had sausages every morning. All in all, it is a good value for a centrally located hotel in a lively area.

Reviews.Title: “Well equipped, good value, suite”
Reviews.Author: Peltt
Reviews.Content: We found Sandman Suites to be ideal for our stay in Vancouver. We made good use of the kitchen and laundry facilities in the suite. There was also much useful storage space for clothes and suitcases. The suite had a combined kitchen and living area with desk and sofa, and a separate bedroom, which shared the balcony. The supermarkets and bakeries were very close by so we could stock up on food for our own meals in the suite. We had a corner suite which gave us good views up Davie Street and across the city skyline. The outdoor pool was fairly small but was heated and we enjoyed making use of that every day. There was also a steam room available. We found it a good value place to stay, and very convenient for walking to most parts of downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby and expensive rooms”
Reviews.Author: LumaNL
Reviews.Content: Vancouver was the last stop on our trip through Canada, so we wanted a luxery hotel. The first night we had a Queenroom, the three nights after a Kingroom. Well, the only difference was the view. Both rooms were very shabby (old carpet, old dirty bathroom, old furniture) and very small. The elivators were very slow, the average waiting-time was 15 minutes. If you're on a lower level you have to wait even longer: the elevator is very small and gets fuller by each level. It was by far the worst and most expensive hotel-experience we'd had in Canada. When the receptionist asked how our stay was, we said it was a bad value for money because of the outdated small rooms and the slow elevator. She said we could expect this because of the summerseason (!!)...

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast - What a Joke”
Reviews.Author: worashy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sandman Suites for 5 nights; actual hotel is great and the Sandman Hotel Staff really helpful. Unfortunately the staff at the Moxies Bar (where breakfast is served) are a complete joke. Never in our years of travel have we come across staff who are unable to actually serve coffee, juice and toast. Below is an indication of breakfast time: 1) We were given plastic straws to remove tea bags out of the cup 2) Waited over 40 mins (on two occassions) for toast and fruit which then had to be sent back once as the toast was stone cold (think we got someone elses order which was sent back). 3) Over five mornings we witnessed 8 breakfasts being sent back due to arriving stone cold. 4) 2 customers actually walked out the breakfast room (sick of waiting) 5) Breakfast staff continuously got orders wrong and far too slow. 6) Sat for 20 minutes before anyone actually came over to take our order so eventually asked the guy cleaning the table next to ours if we could order to then be told he just cleans tables and our server will be over shortly - after waiting for a further 15 minutes asked another member of staff who eventually gave us a cup of tea and toast - unfortunately had to ask AGAIN for orange juice. (this is the norm at Moxies breakfast). In a nutshell the place is a complete joke at breakfast time - the Manager should take note and do something about his staff ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in need of some updating”
Reviews.Author: trueblues
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights visiting for a christening. We wanted to stay in a hotel with kitchen facilities so we could be more relaxed with our friends and prepare our own breakfasts. The facilities were very good and included a washer/dryer machine and fully fitted kitchenette. The bedroom was a bit small but this was compensated by having lounge area with the kitchen. The reception staff were generally helpful except for one female member of staff who was very unhelpful regarding parking and using the hotel safe. The hotel is situated in the gay area of Vancouver with lots of bars, cafes and nightlife. Downtown and Stanley Park are all walkable. The hotel has its own bar and restaurant but we found these expensive and a bit run down. There are lots of other better and cheaper options nearby. We were on the 15th floor and next to the lift which was quite noisy during the night. Also the lifts generally took ages to arrive so this might have contributed to the noise. Our friends room overlooked a pub which stayed open late and again was noisy. In fairness they were offered another room but it was next to the lift so they stayed where they were. We needed car parking for our last night at the hotel and thought this was expensive at £16.50. The hotel was okay for what we wanted but we were left feeling there might have been other better options available for the £550 we paid

Reviews.Title: “A great base to explore Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: Rebeccag77
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was central to most things, and what a good choice it was :) Checking couldn't have been easier - everyone was polite and friendly, and we got a room on floor 20. We liked the fact that the room was a suite, so the was a small area for cooking ie: cooker/fridge/coffee maker/microwave/dishwasher if you wanted to bring food back, or make your own. The suite was fairly basic but clean and comfortable, with a TV in the bedroom and sitting area. We felt that we didn't need anything more, as the room was more or less a base, as we were out most of the time exploring Vancouver. We had complimentary breakfasts in Maxie's restaurant next-door, which consisted of toast & fruit, or sausages/bacon/hash browns with tea/coffee/orange juice. There was also complimentary use of the steam room and gym - I used the eucalyptus steam room a couple of times, which was very relaxing :) You could also connect to the wireless internet service for free, using a code obtained from the front desk. We had a few problems with some transfers which the holiday company had messed up - they couldn't do enough to help us on the front desk, and spent quite some time making phone calls trying to sort it out. They also had maps of the city, and advice on using the Skytrain/buses/taxis if you weren't sure. A definite 10/10 for friendliness and customer service. Davie has literally hundreds of eateries on it, ranging from Transylvanian Cakes (yes really !) from Chinese, Mexican, Thai and Indian; to the usual Burgers, Subway, Denny's, and coffee houses; so you can't go far wrong at all. There were also numerous convenience stores, bakeries and grocers if you preferred to take something back and eat on the balcony.. If you don't walking, you could get to Stanley Park in 10/15 minutes. Downtown / Waterfront was a 15-20 minute walk down Davie, and left along Granville Street which took you to the Waterfront via the main shopping areas. Or if you prefer, walk down Davie to Yaletown/Roundhouse and catch the sky train to the Waterfront which was $3.75 single.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay--great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Zeppy22
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Vancouver--such a friendly city--a stark contrast to Montreal. Perhaps it is because there are so many gay men in the area, but we had a great time in this welcoming city and enjoyed our stay at the Sandman Suites on Davie. We found the room to be quite large--which contradicts what others have written. Our room did have hardwood floors. We had a view of the city and of the bay. The hotel uses cruelty-free bath products, which is much appreciated (most bar soaps contain tallow which is animal fat--no thanks). Great restaurants and bars within walking distance. The washing machine is a bonus, but be forewarned that a load takes four hours, and there is safety timer on the dryer, so you cannot open the door for ten minutes after your clothes are dry which =wrinkles. Also--did not hear any noise from other guests while in our room--this is important to me as I hate thin hotel walls.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a hotel with no public spaces & god help you if there should be a fire!”
Reviews.Author: Cambrigan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sandman suites on Davie for 11 nights in may 2011. The first 48 hours didn't go well: the toilet broke twice & the first full night of sleep to be had after a long flight was interrupted by the fire alarm & all guests evacuated to the street in the early hours. There was no information available & seemingly no staff other than a night porter on duty, although a guy dressed in flip flops & shorts, named Alex, purported to be the manager on duty. It's quite scary to meet fireman wielding axes on the stairwell & difficult to regain sleep when there is no information or reassurance forthcoming. Apparently though this was the 2nd incident in 4 days due to 'a problem with the system'. A written apology to guests was issued next day but no concession for the inconvenience. On picking up my bill I find I'm being charged a higher rate than that quoted at time of booking & as my request for written confirmation was ignored 3 times I don't have any evidence of this. If you decide to stay here request a room with hard wood floors as the carpeted rooms smell bad due to inadequate cleaning. King size suites are small, cramped but well equipped. Sea view overlook the parking lot & side street where very noisy garbage collection takes place at 8am daily.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, would recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: AUandUKcitizen
Reviews.Content: Great location on Davie amongst the cafes and restaurants, with no one looking in your window because it doesn't have any close tall buildings. Good sized suite with separate bedroom, bathroom, good kitchenette with dishwasher, washer-dryer. Free wifi is fast and consistent. Right in the heart of the gay area so the staff are gay or gay friendly, but you don't have to be gay to stay here of course! The only negatives that I can think of are that the washer-dryer takes over half a day to do a single wash-dry load, and the bathroom is rather small so maybe not the best place to stay if you are obese. There is a nightclub along the road a bit, and we could hear the music in the distance in the early hours of the morning, but it wasn't loud enough to wake us up. But really, this is a great place to stay and we will use Sandman again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “On my way to Mexico, there and back!”
Reviews.Author: nadia1975
Reviews.Content: On the way to Mexico I stayed here, and was on the 12th floor, and it was nice, clean, and spacious with a cute kitchen with all the modern amenities. I was even able to throw in a load of shirts before my trip... in the room washer and dryer. It was a very comfortable space, and VERY clean. I was pleased. But the club life does come alive, so if you are on lower floors, and a light sleeper then maybe bring earplugs.. but truly it's not that bad. I AM a light sleeper and didn't wake, once I fell asleep. On my way back I stayed in the suite, and was this time on the 23 floor and it was alot quieter. And I really enjoyed myself, again, very clean and conveinent location. Tons of PRIDE businesses and clubs in the location. A place to truly be yourself, in all it's forms. smile. Again. did my shorts and last minute items from my Mexico trip in the room washer and dryer, and came home with NO laundry. Perfect. And reasonably priced, about 110 or so a night. Only crapper is, even though I PAID cash for my room, and they could OBVIOUSLY see i didn't have a party and break the place apart, they held my card to the balance of the room, for FOUR days, before releasing those funds. Something I find inconveinent, and unfair since THEY got there money. But all HOTELS do that. Something I don't know why... or how come, when it's paid for in cash... and no damage is DONE. But overall it is a good hotel. And i suppose they shouldn't be held accountable for something ALL hotels do. So if you need a hotel... go to them, and if your part of the 'pride' community, then they are a good choice, with friendly, open minded staff, that don't judge at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: Jefito
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sandman Suites in Davie Village for two nights! The room was clean and well appointed and the staff were very helpful and pleasant. The best thing about this hotel was its location! it was right the middle of Davie st, which was always full of activity, very safe(yes it's in the gay district, but it was a friendly and cosy atmosphere), walking distance to everything downtown the beach (English bay and Stanley Park) within 15 min walk, Yaletown(the historic part of the city within 15 min, just a 10 min walk to the ferry for the superb market at Granville Island, 20 mins walk from the famous Robson str and the 250 store mall and thePacific Centre. The price was fair enough for such a hotel...as a drawback, one should consider the high costs for using the parking facilities. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lies about room charges”
Reviews.Author: AdemolaIlorin
Reviews.Content: A suppossed refundable sum of USD306.12 was deducted from my Visa account since 1st November 2010. Despite several calls from Nigeria the money was not refunded. The manager has refused to answer my calls again. I sent email he did not reply. They are fraudulent. I stayed in room 1405 of sandman suites.

Reviews.Title: “I would live here if I lived in Vancouver, BC”
Reviews.Author: scdupont1
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue. We chose Sandman on Davie for the location and price, and we were surprised beyond all expectations. The entire staff was very friendly and professional While checking in, a member of the staff showed us several rooms so we could pick the one we liked the best (must not have been full, but a very nice gesture!). The hotel looks a little older on the outside, but our suite was a one-bedroom king bed facing the bay and mountains. There was a full kitchen (fridge, oven/range, microwave, large sink) and plenty of dishes. The entire suite was hardwood floors and the balcony was amazing. There were flat screen TVs in the living area and bedroom, as well as an office desk with Internet connection (wireless or LAN). My partner and I got married in our suite and the commissioner actually said she would buy the suite if it was a condo. We walked to Stanley Park and rented bikes, got beers and appies along the way. There's also a liquor/beer store, grocery store, $1 store, and many convenience stores within easy walking distance. Also, a lot of restaurants and bars. We stayed 4 nights and were sad to leave. The staff remembered my partner (husband now) and me and were very warm every time we met. The view of the mountains, bay and cityscape, along with the staff and location, made this the perfect place to stay for our trip (and well within our budget) and we WILL stay here the next time we're in Vancouver!!

Reviews.Title: “A PERFECT choice for a kitchenette suite that is affordable! Especially w/ kids!”
Reviews.Author: Scorpion1024
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights at the Sandman on Davie through our travel agent. She got us a great deal for the kitchenette suite. We stayed in room 809 which was a corner unit. 95% of our stay was positive. The positive: - CLOSE to everything you need! 24 hour Shoppers Drug Mart across the street, stores, pub, Starbucks and much more. Also close to Stanley Park and all other tourist attractions. - BEAUTIFUL suite. 1 queen bed in a separate bedroom, nice kitchenette, washer/dryer, balcony which we couldn't stay off of... the view was superb! The suite was CLEAN and furniture was new. - RECEPTION was very helpful! I called from the road (we traveled 5 hours to Vancouver) and asked if our room was ready at 12. She said yes, come whenever you like. So we did. We checked in around 1:30. Quick and easy check in. Very helpful. NEGATIVES: - The hot water was non-existent. I complained at the front desk and they said they would let their maintenance people know. We had to run the water for 15 minutes in the shower to get a warm shower. The sink in the kitchen rarely got luke warm and the sink in the bathroom didn't even get warm once. We tried several times a day. - It can be noisy. If you stand on the balcony, you can hear roof-top furnaces running VERY noisly... but there is tons of hussle and bussle. If you want extreme quiet, don't stay here. You couldn't hear from inside the rooms. - Ice Machine on our floor was VERY loud. TV was distorted (they need to upgrade them), no dish soap in the kitchen... only dishwasher detergent. - I was charged for an extra movie. BE CAREFUL! The remotes are tricky! We accidently "purchased" an extra movie. When I brought this up an checkout, the front desk clerk gladly removed 1 day of parking instead which was a better deal. This is a GREAT choice if you have kids and need an affordable central location. It was perfect because we ate meals in the hotel room instead of spending the money in restaurants and saved our money for attractions and souvenirs. If you are considering this hotel and need questions answered, please let me know. We will definitely stay again! Thank you Sandman on Davie for the excellent customer service!

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alan1766Spain
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from 3 weeks in this hotel and I cannot fault the service we received. The rooms were clean and well appointed and the staff were very pleasant and helpful. We found that reception was first class and could not do enough to help. Yes, it is in the gay district, but we never felt threatened or intimidated. We certainly intend to return next year. Well done Sandman!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again if you paid me, terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: Alix51_10
Reviews.Content: Located in a rough and downmarket area with lots of down and outs hanging around. When emailing my booking I asked for a quiet room because we are both light sleepers.
