I had an email back saying that if we paid to upgraded to a high floor this would be quieter for us and we would get a room with a view of the bay. This we did and again stressed that we did not want to be near a lift, drinks machines etc. On checking in I specifically asked the receptionist 'this is not near a lift is it' to which she replied ' no, its not near a lift'. Could not believe it when we found our room, not only was immediately situated next to the lift , but the backs of both lifts were on the other side of living room wall. Because we had walked round the area for 3 hours waiting for the room and were so tired we decided to give it a go but at 12.30 at night could not stand the noise of the lifts any longer, and asked to be moved. The only other room they could offer us was on a low ffloor on a corner, with 2 busy roads below us. We are really angry that they blatently misled us at reception and did not take in to account one bit our requests. Broken hairdryer in the room and had to make 4 requests for a replacement, which took an hour to arrive. Expensive parking.

Reviews.Title: “Below average. Find somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Traeth
Reviews.Content: We got a deal via Expedia, whereby we paid under the odds for the suite. It still was over-priced. Staying here is like staying in a grubby, badly furnished student flat, The area its in wasn't great, but this wasn't helped by the taxi driver dropping us off near the bins in the lane round the back. It was a poor first impression that didn't really improve a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, view, and service, but wifi lacking”
Reviews.Author: mhale2343
Reviews.Content: If you don't care about wifi this would be an awesome place to stay. If you need to run the occasional ssh session though you should look at other options.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jimyk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent four nights at the Sandman on Davie and loved it. We have been to Vancouver many times and have stayed at a lot of different hotels but now we've found 'the one'. The location couldn't be better. As previously stated it's very close to everything you could want. The suites are very well appointed, and the kitchen is well stocked with everything you need to prepare a meal if you choose to. Having the option of a washer and dryer was an added bonus. We chose the ocean view suite when we booked and were very happy that we did, the view was amazing and well worth the extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great Area For Beginners...”
Reviews.Author: ajlady77
Reviews.Content: First time in Canada- and I went alone. I was a bit apprehensive about the whole thing- but it was a great area. Sandman suites on Davie was alright; the elevators have a mind of their own. W/in 2 blocks there are 2 Starbucks, a Greek deli (yummy pitas) Stepho's Greek restaurant (good calamari), Moxie's next door, a grocery store, a pharmacy, Kinko's, 2 french bakeries, 2 Indian- 2 sushi restaurants and a great produce store a few steps from the entrance of the hotel; you really don't have to go far for a lot of variety in food. The bus runs on Davie street which is convenient; and Robson street isn't far where there are a lot of apparel stores (& there's a Mall about a mile away). I took an amazing sight-seeing tour that picked me up from my hotel, and I felt plenty safe walking around looking for bookstores and restaurants at night by myself. Sandman definitely isn't the Marriott or Embassy Suites, but it suited me just fine for a trip alone. The hotel staff are OK, some are pretty nice & others act like they are there cause they have to pay their bills (they move pretty slow- but I wasn't in a hurry so I didn't let them stress me- until I needed toilet tissue and it took them 50 minutes to bring it to my room). The bedroom in the standard room is pretty small. I wouldn't have wanted to sleep there w/ another person; would have felt a bit claustrophobic. Was there for the sight seeing and that made it a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not coming there any more ,”
Reviews.Author: indrawiguna76
Reviews.Content: the carpet was ver smelly especialy. need new carpet immediately. the customer service was ok but tahe a lot of time to figure everything out. jist an ok room , just cant stand the smell of the carpet. and the washing machine broke , not an enjoyable stay .

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever.”
Reviews.Author: PortlandMorgan
Reviews.Content: Not only did an employee walk into my room unannounced, without even knocking, while I was in bed but the hotel double-charged me for my room. I have called them back on multiple occasions and not one person has bothered to follow up with me. It's three weeks later and I still have not received a refund or even a call back. Every employee I have spoken with is apathetic and incompetent and I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bikeco
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights the rates were very reasonable. We got upgraded to a bay view which was spectacular. Took some beautiful pictues of the sunset right from our balcony. Never got tired of looking out or sitting on the balconly. The room was spacious with a kitchen and washer/dryer. The location was central to the beach and lots of great places to eat including bakeries nearby. Easy to walk everywhere from the hotel. The parking was secure. The front desk was very helpful. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Quite A Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tchochtke
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Vancouver a while back, but am very conscious of the old saying that company and fish go bad in three days - so for this trip I needed to stay for 5 or so days, I decided to get a place to crash. I was also conscious about my decision, because I have a restrictive diet (celiac/ no eggs/ no milk), so it is often difficult to eat out all of the time. The solution was to stay at the Sandman Suites Davie Downtown, and it was a great solution. The suite itself was a one bedroom suite, I booked a bit of a nicer room, so they bumped me up to a top floor upon check-in. The space was clean, a full kitchen, with utensils, etc. The great thing too is that there is a 24 hour Supervalu right across the street, and a veggie market on the main floor of the hotel as well - so you don't need to spend a lot on food if you don't want to. The other great thing about being on Davie, is that there are a million different types of take aways - from Singaporean, to 50's Diner, to Japanese to Greek - you can pretty much get any type of food you could ever imagine. The suite itself was excellent - well cooled (a great air conditioner), and the staff at the front were very helpful. Another great thing is that there is a taxi stand right outside the door, so I literally never had to wait for a cab when I wanted one. The drawback of this space was the room service - there really wasn't any - you had to call down the Moxies on the ground floor, and for the pain and agony, you may as well walk down the block and go and pick up a couple of $2 pieces of pizza. But generally this was a great place to stay - right in the hub of transportation and food, close to downtown, and yet very livable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location, Fabulous Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: FlynnsterSanJose
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vancouver and I picked the perfect hotel! I was on the 19th floor with a spectacular view of the downtown. The room had everything, full kitchen, washer/dryer, wifi, tv and sound system, even a dishwasher! There is a super right up the street for supplies, so I could cook, picnic on the beach which is a couple of blocks away, or just pack snacks and hike to the downtown. This hotel is in a great location and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location-clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: tobee888
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one week from 28th July to 4th of August and found the hotel to be conveniently located for all the tourist attractions and clean and comfortable.The room was cleaned and the towels changed on a daily basis and when I called the front desk for missing toiletries they were delivered to the room within 10 minutes.Housekeeping staff were always pleasant if we met them in the corridors or lifts. The front desk were pleasant and helpful with the exception of one young woman whom I found to be incredibly rude on each occasion that I spoke to her,but that would not deter us from staying here again. There were only two lifts working during our whole stay and they were incredibly slow and always busy. Our stay coincided with the Gay Pride festival and although the street was busy and lively this in no way affected our sleep quality. The suite concept was great as we could eat in or out as we pleased and the washer/drier was excellent for doing laundry before leaving to join our cruise to Alaska. There are many restaurants and convenience stores on the street, although we found everything very expensive(the addition of tax to everything purchased made the prices even higher) We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Front Desk and Cleaning Service at a $200/Night Hotel”
Reviews.Author: August1966
Reviews.Content: Poor front desk service along with no suite cleaning service (no fresh towels, bed linen's, etc). Passenger elevators were always used by staff with bags of garbage, dirty linen, even a greasy work trolley and ladders! We were even told to notify the front desk of our coming and goings because how else does the cleaning staff know to do up the room! When we complained about the suite not being cleaned, we got nothing but bad attitude service from the front desk staff (we felt we were like being treated badly when asked about the service). When cleaning staff did come, she could not even speak English so we had to leave our suite for a couple hours so it could be cleaned. We had inquired about why a "stay" room is not cleaned (or at least fresh towels) and the front desk manager at the time said "stay rooms are not cleaned because our cleaning staff only work from 9-5) and rooms that are checked out get priority! Doesn't make sense to me, isn't it the other way around? Even upon checking out I asked for the GM business card and the front desk girl literally threw the card at me! So, if you need a downtown hotel in Vancouver...don't stay at the Sandman Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory and well located”
Reviews.Author: kawaguy
Reviews.Content: Don't confuse this with the other Sandman, and do look on the map to make sure you know where it is relative to where you are going. If you're planning to walk everywhere, know that the hotel is at the top of a hill that is steep in some directions. Our experience matched the average review here. Notes: (1) the air conditioner was a bit noisy but effective; consider that only if you are fussy about such things. (2) We enjoyed the Moxie's restaurant downstairs and felt the prices were fair (3) July 2010 and one of the three elevators was once again out of service; the remaining two were S-l-o-w. (4) The Shopper's Drug Mart across the street is open 24/7 (5) Don't be put off by the comments about the Gay District; unless you are homophobic it just won't be a factor. (6) Parking below the hotel is secure enough that I didn't worry.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value for the price & fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: faith4a21
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Sandman Suites on Davie st. First of all, for the price it was an unbelievable value! It’s totally worth what we paid (we bought it on expedia) as it was much better than we expected! the suites were very clean, loved having the kitchen and all the amenities, free wireless, it was very secure, & the staff were very friendly. We got upgraded to a King oceanview suite which was pretty sweet! the view was fabulous. The only problem we had was a minor problem with the shower but that was fixed very promptly. The best thing about this hotel was its location! it was right the middle of Davie st, which was always full of activity, very safe, walking distance to everything downtown, lots of amazing and interesting restaurants nearby (must try Banana Leaf on Denman st for amazing Malaysian food -- a member of front desk recommended it to us -- and also Lolita’s and Bin 949 on davie), the beach (English bay) within 15 min walk, Yaletown within 15 min, Robson st within 10 min, a Shoppers across the street, Cob’s bread right next door, lots of grocery stores within 5 min walk. We never ate at the Moxies downstairs or ordered room service, but that was pretty convenient to have - we just preferred eating at unique, independent restaurants rather than franchises. It was totally worth it and much better than some other pricier hotels that I had friends staying at (who were not happy with them). Plus we had excellent weather the days we were there so couldn’t ask for more! :)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean & great location”
Reviews.Author: MrsJouse
Reviews.Content: It's not a pretty hotel from the outside, but I was pleasantly surprised by the spacious 1 bedroom suite (considering it's downtown vancouver). Room was very clean and fantastic view over English Bay. Very useful to have the kitchen facility so you don't always have to eat out (plus you can cook some of the fab food you can get at Granville Market). The location is slightly out of the glitzy downtown scene, but more in a vibrant "real" downtown full of small restaurants, shops and people who actually live in the city so we felt we got a better feel for the city. We felt very safe walking around. It's very handy for bus travel and also the mini ferries on false creek. Only slight downside is some rooms will have noise from the lift shaft as it's a very tall but narrow hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable BnB Accomodation, Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Calindoo
Reviews.Content: If like ourselves you just want somewhere to use as a base for a couple of nights, then the Sandman Suites were fine - clean, good space and even a built in kitchen! Only 10 minutes from Vancouver centre and 10 minutes down to English Bay Beach. Breakfast wise there is a Starbucks 5 minutes from the Hotel, though we would recommend 'The Dish' deli which is also 5 mins from the hotel. This little place provides a great breakfast with fresh juice at a reasonable price, and the bread is great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: SantenayKent
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nts. Briliant! Great location; free internet, heated outdoor pool, full size kitchen - and a great restaurant bar downstair! The Sandman's situation on Davie St is perfect for discovering Vancouver. Just a 10 min walk to the ferry for the superb market at Granville Island. 20 mins walk from the 250 store mall - Pacific Centre and plenty of restaurants and bars along Davie St. A 24 hour drug store across the street for basic foods, drinks, forgotten toiletries... The staff are very pleasant and helpful and rooms are cleaned daily. TV in living room and bedroom. Bathroom a little cramped but no more than an average hotel room. We would definitely stay here again as the location is so convenient and it's a good safe area.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: SerendipityBlue
Reviews.Content: We found this apartment-hotel last minute and are so glad we did. It's a few minutes drive to Stanley Park and Granville Island. Really you can walk there but uphill can be a challenge. RELAXATION: There`s a spa right in the facility. Looked wonderful. FURNISHING: Our room came equipped with plates, utensils, etc. We had to buy a couple of things but there's a dollar store a few blocks away. ACCESS TO SUPPLIESéFOOD: Across the street is a Shoppers Drug Mart that sells groceries (excluding fresh fruit) but there's a market just downstairs and a fresh Cobs Bakery. We had amazingly fresh bread and fruits and vegetables every day. You can buy laundary and dish detergent at the shoppers but also available at the dollar store. THINGS TO DO: If you have young kids, just down the hill there`s a beach but further on there`s two playground (Stanley Park area) where the kids can play and walk along the beach making sand castles and collecting sea shells. During the day you can walk far out to the water and see all the fun water life (oysters, clams, etc.). There are tons of places you can eat. We had a rental handy so it was easy for us to drive out buy really, you can walk to a lot of the places. CONS: Not really much to complain about. The elevators are uber slow on teh weekends. I had to wait about 10 minutes on the Saturday morning we were there. I`d walk down but we were on the 16th floor. Night life can be noisy (though we really didn`t mind). Housekeeping sometimes missed our room (again, didn`t mind so much). FREE: internet, newspaper PARKING: Gated parking so pretty safe. $18/day POOL: Outdoors

Reviews.Title: “not bad, great views and location”
Reviews.Author: mimum
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with various members of my family last year. We had 3 rooms, each with one bedroom, a foldaway bed in the lounge area and a kitchenette also in the lounge area, en suite. I stayed in a room facing the sea, which was fantastic as the views were lovely and we had a small balcony. My brother stayed in a room facing the opposite direction, which still had great views but if you have a choice then go for the rooms facing English Bay. The kitchen was fine, however I dont think that the water was drinkable, whether it was that we just happened to have some problems with it or that it is always like that Im not sure, but it was a bit of a pain. However the staff were very helpful and professional. The Sandman was fine, good in fact. It didn't impress me to the point where I can rave about it but I would stay there again. It is located on Davie Street which is what you could call the gay quarter - it is very central and the street is buzzing and interesting, but not really upmarket. I would recommend this hotel, perhaps even just for its location - close to the city centre, Stanley Park and English Bay, with easy links to other areas of Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Not Too Shabby”
Reviews.Author: ThisIsNotMe
Reviews.Content: The location and service were the best qualities at this hotel. The property is located on Davie Street, right in the heart of Vancouver's Gay Village. Near-by their are many ethnic and fast food restaurants, as well as a Moxies on-site, grocery stores, 24 hour pharmacy, convenience stores, an Internet cafe and many night clubs. Robson Street, the one of the city's prime shopping areas, is within walking distance, and public transportation taking you to the other areas of Vancouver is also near by. The staff were excellent; very friendly and helpful, and the manager seemed to have a great deal of knowledge on the city's attractions. The suites are excellent for the price you pay for them. They come equipped with a fair-sized fridge, stove, microwave, dishwasher, washer and dryer, coffee maker and even utensils and cooking equipment. The beds and bedding can use a bit of updating, but apart from that, I had no real complaints about it. However, my one complaint about this property was the hit and miss connections with the free Internet. It would work fine sometimes, but some nights they were so bad, I would have to go to the Internet cafe down the road just to check my e-mail. This hotel met my expectations to various levels, but I would be more than likely to return here if and when I come back to the Vancouver area.

Reviews.Title: “good quality and great location”
Reviews.Author: kangercol
Reviews.Content: pre-booked before going to Canada so was much cheaper than walking in to book. Well equipped apartment with a fab view of the ocean, brilliant restaurant downstairs which you could bill to your room - the food was amazing, the environment was great and service was top class, we ended up eating there nearly every night of our stay. I couldn't fault this accommodation, will stay there again when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Penthouse, Friendly Staff, Special Place for Special Times”
Reviews.Author: Moonsoon33
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in Penthouse #6 for 3 nights over the last weekend in November. It was, without a doubt, an amazing room with a spectacular view of English Bay and the North Shore. From the jacuzzi tub, to the ultra-comfy bed, neat shower and the spacious room with a small kitchenette....it was worth every penny and more. Price-wise, for this wonderful room, this was much more affordable than any other penthouse suite in the city (trust me, I did my homework). The location could not have been better, as we walked all over the city, throughout Stanley Park and enjoyed all the wonderful coffee shops & cafes that Davie Street had to offer. The hotel staff were super friendly, real people, with diverse personalities and backgrounds (a true reflection of Vancouver). Housekeeping did a wonderful job each morning - Zoe deserves kudos for keeping our room super clean and neat. The Australian man that checked us in was so nice and helpful. I hope he has a wonderful trip back home this month. Being from Vancouver, this vacation at home was made extra special by our stay at the Sandman Suites. My boyfriend, from Arizona, was super impressed with the room and location. Without any hesitation, I would stay here again and again. Thank you Sandman Suites and staff.

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff, great location, what else can you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: heou87
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I decided to escape American Thanksgiving by spending it in Vancouver. I decided to stay at the Sandman Suites on Davie based on other reviews. The hotel lives up to the review. Incredible staff, very friendly, respectful and eager to help. They're also very knowledgeable of the area. I asked the front desk for recommendation and he pointed me to Tojo restaurant (the best Omakase experience I ever tried) Chris, front desk, was extremely helpful when there were some problems with my credit charges. kudos to him Definitely would come back to this hotel if I came back to Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: missjennymarie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sandman Suites for 3 nights in October. The entire experience at the hotel was a great one. The front desk check in was quick and easy with knowledgeable staff. (Though the decor in the lobby is quite strange, but it's personal taste.) We got up to our room on the 18th floor and the view was amazing! We had the perfect view of the north shore mountains on one side and English Bay on the other (it made for a beautiful photograph). The room was moderately spaced but was decorated beautifully and everything looked brand new. The bed was extremely comfortable, which is very important in what everyone looks for in a hotel! The housekeeping service was excellent and fast and very accommodating with when to return to have the room made up. The only complaint I have with this hotel was the bathroom was fairly tiny...it was clean and everything worked perfectly, just not so spacious. The spa at the hotel was very nice. The staff were friendly and welcoming and put you at ease as soon as you walk in the door. All in all, we had an excellent stay and would love to go back again for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Location and Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jasmine1202
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Sandman on Davie 4 times in the last 3 years, my husband and I stay there everytime we go to Vancouver since we first found out about it. This past August we stayed there for our honeymoon, I called to book a couple months ahead and asked since it was our honeymoon if we could have a high floor with a good view. We booked an oceanview room and they assured me that we would have a great view on our honeymoon. Upon checking into the hotel when we arrived we were pleasantly surprised that they had actually upgraded us to a penthouse suite free of charge! They also gave us a gift certificate for the on-site spa. (Unfortunately we weren't able to stay long enough to use it with so much to do, hopefully it will work next time) We were really pleased with the room, the beautiful view, theJacuzzi and the staff as usual! Have seen some negative comments on the location but really the location is great, walking distance to english bay and pretty much anywhere else in downtown Vancouver, my husband and I love our stays at the Sandman on Davie, frequently walking to English bay and Robson Street, plus there are tons of great Restaurants and Sushi places right on Davie! We will definitely be back next year for our aniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Dusty , poor cleaning of room”
Reviews.Author: BusyBee70
Reviews.Content: You could see dust everywhere. Bathroom wasn't cleaned while we stayed here. Expected better for what they charged for the room. Washer didn't work properly. Bed was sagging, we kept rolling to the middle of bed.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: blakey826
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the sandman suites with my partner for 2 weeks in early September. I would say that for the money this was a good hotel. We arrived at the hotel and initially had to be change rooms due to a noisy generator on an adjoining roof. After this we were moved to 4th floor which was ideal as it was only a short trip in the lifts. Hotel has good facilities, pool, fitness suite and steam room. Any queries we had reception dealt with swiftly. There was only one thing I would highlight to consider if thinking about staying here: 1/ lower down in the hotel, floors 4-7 there is a buzzing sound that originates from the bottom of the lifts. This noise disappears when your travel higher up in the lifts. This was not really a problem for me as I sleep through anything but it did wake my girlfriend a few times. If you can request higher up in the building then I would do so. Overall excellent value for money. Location good, situated within 'gay davie village' but this never posed any problems for us.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, LOCATION NO SO GREAT”
Reviews.Author: catlover3Washington
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights. This was at the end of a Cosmos tour of Canada, beginning with Toronto (partly by train) to Vancouver. A great tour, by the way. This hotel is very nice, clean, nothing to complain about. We loved the kitchen, prepared our breakfasts and one dinner. We also loved the washer/dryer combination, and we were able to wash up a few things--after ten plus days. There was a living room with a hide-a-bed, and a bedroom. Both living room and bedroom had TV sets. Our only complaint would be the location of the hotel. Surrounded by slightly seedy shops, including at least three "adult" shops, one even a so called peep show (whatever that is). We walked one block, and were able to pick up the "Big Red Bus." That was very convenient. We would recommend this hotel with reservations, only if you can get over the location.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the value, great location”
Reviews.Author: cheaptravelbug
Reviews.Content: The hotel is overall a 3.5 star I would say. We stayed at the suite with the kichenette, got a last minute deal and paid about $100/night. No real complaints. Its clean, spacious, bedroom is more private, and GREAT location. There's a mart down the street where we got some snacks and drinks for the kitchenette. It was very safe to walk around the neighborhood, plenty of people out walking so you don't feel uncomfortable. I know some people prefer to be in downtown proper but I enjoyed the fact that we were away from everything just a bit. We did get a rental car (Vancouver is very easy to drive around if you are used to driving in California) so we had no issues getting anywhere if we needed to. But we ended up walking around every night the 3 days we were there. Even though not in downtown proper we had plenty of exploring to do and had no issues finding restaurants and stores to browse. Its only 10 min drive to everything. It was the better/somewhat more modern/cleaner version of a business suite in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great to stay on Davie”
Reviews.Author: spoons74
Reviews.Content: Let me say this. Davie st is right smack in the middle of the Gay district of a proud Vancouver. Gay, Lesbian, Straight, A-Sexual...go for it, this is definitely a great place to hang out. Vancouver is an amazing city, where the harbour hangs with the parks, and mountains form a post card back drop. In the old days, Kodak would have made a fortune selling you film, its cities like this where you give thanks for digital technology. Sightseeing - a cycle through stanley park is a must - you can walk 10 mins from the hotel and pay about 5 bucks an hour. stop for a local lager in the centre of the park to quench a sweaty thirst. Also take the ferry, more like something you'd see in a child's bath, over to Granville island...the foods not great if eating there, though local produce in the summer market is stunning. Its a small city so you can just walk every where. Eating - sushi is big and can be eaten almost anywhere! Maxims next to the hotel is good fusion food, though avoid the lamb (and you can charge to your room) and Stephos on Davie, well this Greek joint is well worth queuing for. The Sandman Suites on Davie was clearly an older hotel, though they have give it a good lick (of paint) and is in good nick. The lobby is funky and in keeping with the environs, the rooms are spacious and all have a balcony, fridge and washing machine. There is A/C though its pretty noisy. If feeling rough, take advantage of the steam room and pool area, its pretty handy. The location is excellent. There is so much happening on the doorstep, great people watching and all the convenient shops you'd need (drugstore, bakery, starbucks, kevin kebab shop, chinese laundry). Don't be put off by the 25c peepshows across the road. cant imagine you see much for 25c. The service was exceptional, especially from the front office manager Eugene. 5 stars to him. Downsides were very slow lifts (sometimes waiting to descent for 10 mins) and there were never enough staff at check in or out. If you're going for a drive around BC and returning to Vancouver, they'll happily store your excess luggage for no fee. and the internet is free (albeit a little slow) if you have your own laptop. If you die before seeing Vancouver, well thats just a shame. Its worth every effort to travel there! I'm full of tips...drop me a line. Love in travel Spoons xx

Reviews.Title: “really NOT impressed...”
Reviews.Author: Mista-go
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the super-glamour hall of this hotel...soon you will discover that the rooms are equipped with plywood furniture and that they would need a refurbishment. We had to ask for help beacause we were not able to open the french window but it turned out that it was blocked, so we had to move to another room because we needed some fresh air inside the room. The kitchenette and the washing machine are very handy, and the view form the window is really nice, but all in all we would not come back in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Met all our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Baly50
Reviews.Content: Great location, room facilities good, pool great, staff exceptionally helpful. Only downside is noise from the extractor fan above the night club next door - just stay on the pool side or high up then there's no problem - staff happy to change rooms. Gives you the option of self catering right in the heart of Vancouver. Overall very good - we would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for 1 or 2 people”
Reviews.Author: JonnySan
Reviews.Content: Only stayed 1 night, 17 July. Room was on 23rd floor facing the water , no complaints about that for sure. Check in was smooth, happy to say all 3 elevators working after reading of issues with them in earlier reviews. Room was very nice, hardwood floor in "kitchen" area and carpet in bedroom. Kitchen had all the niceties and along with coffee maker also had a separate hot pot for tea and anything else. Two TV's , 1 in bedroom. Bathroom was small as has been previous noted but nothing to complain about. Room also had combo washer/dryer, I tried to dry some pants but they got semi washed for some reason. If I was staying more than 1 day I would have asked the desk to look into it, see if it was me or the machine. Parking for checking in is located behind the hotel, and the parking garage is there also. If you take the stairs from the lobby to the garage it is very easy to come out on wrong floor, just a lot of doors to go through. When walking to Robinson Street for shopping, take the 1st street to the west of the lobby, very nice tree lined 10 min walk , when its hot it is much nicer walking back up the hill in the shade. I would say the room was ideal for 2 adults, if you had more it could get a little close depending how much time you spent there. Small children would be ok on a lower floor, the balcony is certainly sturdy and well built, but I'm sure some parents would be uneasy that high up. Overall a very good deal, I would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: brian17
Reviews.Content: After mixed reviews my girlfriend and I opted for this property due to a great price for 7 nights. Any apprehension was lost from the start. We were greeted with a smile and at just on 13:00 our room was ready! One of 3 elevators did not work for the week we were there but the other 2 were ok. There are over 20 floors to service so it takes time! Our stay on the 15th floor was great. The view was incredible and inside the suite was not bad either! Full modern stylish kitchen facilities including dish washer and washer/dryer were at our disposal. Large TV and Wi-fi, it had it all. The bedroom sported another large TV and air-con unit. Throughout the suite, plenty of hanging space and complimentary bath robes. Davie st. has a great community spirit with many bars, restaurants and clubs nearby. Also 2 supermarkets meant everything was to hand. Public transport on doorstep and easy walking in any direction contributed to a great stay. An excellent though pricey Moxie's grill bar/restaurant on site also provided room service. A complimentary safety deposit box was also a nice touch. Staff were very helpful and answered all my questions. Davie st. might not be for everybody since it has a large gay community with after dark noise, might pose a problem fo families. Overall, it was tops! this property really enhanced our stay in this magnificent city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: siucarnpb
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel with reservations after reading reviews. I arrived early from Whistler, the front desk manager Justin, checked me right in. I had concerns over my car, as Vancouver does have a homeless problem and they like to break into cars. he said it was an issue, but to park my car on the lowest level of parking away from the gates. It was fine my whole stay, 3 levels down, the hotel is security locked also. He also gave me suggestions on what to do in the area, talked to him a few times, he was great. The only issue was my room, it wasn't clean yet, this wasn't an issue to me though, as they checked me in early. Went back down and the manager Eugene was at the front desk, he was very concerned and apologized and I explained it was not a big deal to me ( as I checked in early), he immediately upgraded me to the Penthouse floor to a suite and offered to move my bags. The room is great and have enjoyed it. Yes there are homeless, but all of Vancouver has this issue, just not this area, the elevators are slow, but whats 2 extra mins, yes there is street noise, IT'S A BIG CITY!. Everything is close, yaleville, shopping all close. This is a perfect hotel if your looking to be in the middle of the gay area of Vancouver. Also try the restaurant, had lunch and drinks, the manager was friendly and the bartender Brian talked to me for hours about my 2 month long road trip and adventures he has taken. Food was great. I would stay here again no problem......The high speed internet is free too

Reviews.Title: “Depressing street - homelessness”
Reviews.Author: VancouverPlayethic
Reviews.Content: Hotel okay but we hated being approached for money every time we went out, and men sitting on sidewalk here and there with hats and signs out about needing money for food, and just in the two blocks by the hotel we'd often see 6-10 people in sleeping bags splayed on sidewalks. We were shocked, for Canada, or what we heard of Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Great apartments for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Biggin
Reviews.Content: Stopped at the Sandman in February this year as part of our second trip to Vancouver. Compared to other hotels this was a fairly reasonably priced hotel. the rooms were nicely sized, and as we were ski-ing the washing machine came in handy. We had room service on one occasion and this was very nice too. Overall a good budget option of yuowant to be abel to cater for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Rambling_Canuck
Reviews.Content: Including taxes, I paid about 142$CAD for this room (approx $111USD). For its location in Vancouver, I think it's a great deal. The staff was very pleasant and accommodating. The rooms themselves are a little dated in my opinion, but there is a nice television and full kitchen amenities. The sofa bed is small - fits one comfortably. If you are going to be 2 in the sofa bed, be prepared to be close! Also, there were insufficient covers on the sofa bed. The bedroom (separate) was small but perfectly acceptable and comfortable. I would definitely stay here again. Not that it was such a great hotel, it's a nice hotel. But I thought it was great value.

Reviews.Title: “Stinks!”
Reviews.Author: supperplease
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel I've ever stayed in. Rude. No appliances worked. Elevators didn't work properly; wasted a great deal of our valuable time. Service HORRIBLE. Overall, VILE!

Reviews.Title: “Our Own Condo in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Mobile_Mirandas
Reviews.Content: We finally had a chance to stay at the Sandman Suites on Davie in September, and we seemed to experience a little bit of everything from most of the reviews. Overall we really enjoyed our stay, and having a full kitchen (especially with Granville Island so close by) made for a much more local experience. The elevators were slow (they really do take a ridiculously long time), but the staff was friendly and helpful. When we went to leave our suite for the first time, it turned out that the door wouldn't lock behind us. It took about 20 minutes for the front desk to send someone up (probably waiting for an elevator) - and when he got there we left him to it. We came back about 3 hours later, and found out room unlocked (the door was shut, but the lock still didn't work). They got the problem fixed the second time around - but that was a minor annoyance. To the hotel's credit, they did offer to move us to a different room, but we had completely unpacked and unloaded our groceries in the kitchen by then, so we passed on that. Davie street has a lot of bars and restaurants, and with the windows open (even from the 17th floor) you can hear all the action. Luckily we had the a/c unit - which as mentioned in other reviews is noisy, but that helped drown the street noise out. The mornings were quite peaceful, and it was nice to be able to have so many windows to catch the sun rising over the mountains. I would definitely recommend this hotel for those that want to be close to the action of bars, restaurants, and Granville Island - just be aware that there will be noise - but that's part of the fun of Davie street!

Reviews.Title: “Made our honeymoon even more enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: AlyWeir
Reviews.Content: We ended our honeymoon in the Sandman Suites in Vancouver. I was a bit apprehensive as to what to expect from this hotel as we had booked it at a very reasonable price on Hotwire. I can safely say I couldn't have been happier with the hotel. I went to reception to ask the check in staff about whale watching tours in Vancouver, but as they were busy at the time, the valet staff helped me. The valet staff member went out of his way to get all the information needed, costs, times etc and asked me to come back to him and let me know if we enjoyed ourselves so that he could infom other customers. The rooms were very clean and the spacious (the bathroom was perhaps on the small side) and had balconies (good for all the smokers). I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, rooms so so”
Reviews.Author: Corvus47
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience at the Sandman Suites, but only because they gave us a free upgrade. We had a terrible time getting to the hotel from the airport, with the commercial airport shuttle forgetting to drop us at the hotel and refusing to go back. We got the hotel finally, and they sent us up to our room, but the room was trashed. We didn't even walk in, just from opening the door, you could see that it was in disarray. We went back down to regitration, and they upgraded us to the penthouse suite. That was a very nice room - well decorated with good views and very clean. We later stayed in a regular room, and it was a little dingy and had a hole in the wall. My advice is that if you spring for the room upgrade, its worthwhile, otherwise, its what you'd expect from a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Happy I took the chance”
Reviews.Author: M00se1111
Reviews.Content: After some earlier accomodation issues, I went back to stay at the Sandman. What a great decision. I admit I was a bit concerned about some of the claims, but I found the hotel to be very clean and well kept in a great location in Vancouver. I was upgraded when I arrived and had a room with an ocean view. The views were breath taking. Having a supermarket up the street and Shoppers Drug Mart across the street helped me keep my in room frig full! Each and every member of the front desk staff went above and beyond to make sure I had a great stay. Should anyone want a "suite like" hotel in Vancouver. Look no where else.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: flymo68
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 days in mid/late October, had one of the smaller suites but the size was more than adequate - and the price was exceptional value. Facilities were great, as were the staff. We arrived well before check-in time, having had a morning flight from the UK, no problems checking in early. Location is excellent - know the area well having stayed at the Sheraton on previous visits, but it will be the Sandman on further visits. Does everything it says on the tin and more besides.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!!! Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: ericskilling
Reviews.Content: While having an in suite kitchen was a nice touch. The fact that the heating for the suite did not work at all for the entire duration of my 6-day stay was inexcusable. Also, the water in the shower was barely warm at the best of times and cold for the last two. I had to wash my hair in the bathroom sink because oddly the water was hot in there. As far as the internet: no wireless and speeds comparable to dial-up and would randomly cut off. I will make a point of letting everyone I know how unhappy I was here and to recommend they stay elsewhere. No apology short of some sort of refund will make me happy. Thanks Sandman for ruining my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: LS25
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great value for money. We had a great room that had a fantastic view of English Bay. The room was well equipped and clean. We didn't experience any problems with the lifts although I guess we were there out of season so it was not that busy. The location is good with plenty of bars, restaurants and grocery stores on the doorstep. It felt a really safe neighbourhood. Its not far to Stanley Park which is well worth a visit. Would defintatley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Super Location”
Reviews.Author: gaararules
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel with all the amenities you could possibly wish for. We had a living room, bedroom, and a full kitchen. Even a washer and dryer! We requested a room with an ocean view, and we were truly rewarded with one on the 20th floor. The location was superb too! Tons of eateries all around, and 3 blocks away from the beach. About the same distance from Robson street and the amazing shopping. Can't say enough good things about this place. Clean, spacious, neat and tidy, good service. And considering the location, it is really well priced.

Reviews.Title: “WArning - bed bugs alive and well at the Sandman on Davie!”
Reviews.Author: NekkoOttawa
Reviews.Content: First advice to you: never stay at the Sandman on Davie! While in Vancouver on business I stayed at the Sandman on Davie in September 2008 and I ended up with over 50 bed bug bites on my face, neck, arms & legs. The Sandman staff requested I see a doctor at the nearby walk-in clinic, and the doctor there confrimed to me that bed bugs are 'Vancouver's dirty secret', and that I take benadryl & apply creams to soothe the itchiness. The Sandman staff gave me a change of room and assured me they would properly clean my clothes and provide me with a report of the bed bugs issue in the previous room. The next day the Sandman staff returned to me my clothes in a bag. The clothes were not cleaned. In fact any clothes that were just recently dry cleaned and laundered were now in a pile at the bottom of a bag. I was not provided with a report. I got out as quickly as I can (only after having to justify to one of the managers my break in the committed stay at the Sandman!!??)! Try to imagine how embarrassing it is to have business conferences with red swollen bites that look like big mosquito bites all over your body! I promised them that I would post negative comments about them on web sites, and advise my employers to break engagement with them. I'm the only one who is committed to my promises in the relationship with the Sandman hotel on Davie... Last advice to you: never stay at the Sandman on Davie!

Reviews.Title: “A dreadful hotel in a lovely city”
Reviews.Author: Fneepette
Reviews.Content: These suites were a low point in an otherwise great trip. The location is yards from the gay quarter with lots of bars and clubs, but also yards from the red light district - being propositioned on your way home from dinner is not fun. The first room we were shown did not have functional heating. When the manager attempted to rectify this a large chunk of piping came away from the wall. We asked to be moved. The second room stank of smoke. The hotel management assured us it was a non-smoking suite, but the stench suggested otherwise. They showed us to a third suite which we accepted out of desperation. It had a toilet unit propped up by folded beeer mats which rocked every time it was used. The french windows did not fully close, leaving us with an icy draft and a lot of noise. We complained and were offered a small discount of a breakfast in the restaurant. Insult added to injury - we sought breakfast elsewhere. On departure we complained again and were told we could claim 15% of our next stay. It's an offer we wont be taking up, I was devastatingly disappointed that such a lovely city was ruined by a horrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good option but may need earplugs”
Reviews.Author: KK06
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights and overall found it a good place to stay in terms of location and suite facilities and was going to give 4 stars as staff helpful as well but... First room I was given was on 6th floor, on side with no water views and was noisy outside (traffic and some sort of extraction system from next building) and in (ice machine was just outside) and was non-smoking (I had booked smoking), though was told I could smoke on balcony. Complained about noisy ice machine and eventually moved to smoking room on 14th floor, with lovely ocean view and better arrangement of living room/kitchen facilities but right behind the lifts and they were a bit noisy in the night (though better than ice machine). Even on that floor the traffic noise was intrusive when balcony door was open. An odd thing was that the bedroom didn't have any curtains (only nets) - not a privacy issue on a high floor and luckily it didn't get light too early but the promised curtains never did materialise during my stay. I wasn't keen on Moxie's breakfast but as others have mentioned there are plenty of restaurants, supermarkets, fruit shops, bakers, etc very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: janicetran
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent, it is right next to a busy fruit market and right across the street is a shoppers drug mart. A TON of restaurant within 5 minutes of walking, including an amazing Greek restaurant that you have to wait 45 minutes to get into. The hotel itself was very good. Everything was fairly new and very clean. The suite I was in had hardwood floor and the appliances look new. They have a tiny washer/dryer in one that is convenient for those staying a bit longer. I stayed with my family so the suite made it feel more like home. The view from the 23rd floor was breathtaking. If you are looking to take a "Big Bus" city tour, one of their stops is down the street. Also, all the main buses that bring you to touristy places go a long the street as well.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: SSAN
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, and... that is it. Sorry, but you have to be very patient if you decided to stay at the Sandman. First of all, thereare only 2 working elevators and it takes between 5 to 10 minutes to get down or up. Secondly, airconditoner is really old and it didn`t work. The front desk send us a fan and we heard that other guests had similiar problems with their A/C. Services are just ok and overall the room is very old and ugly. the bed is crampted in a small area of the room. unconfortable. we changed hotels in the midlle of our trip...

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Nabaaty
Reviews.Content: I visit beautiful Vancouver any chance I get and I have been in many hotels in this city. My top of line fav is Sandman Suits on Davie because of its great location and price value. The hotel is part of Canadian chain hotels which are 3 stars but I think this hotel is 3.5 or 4 stars. If you are in Vancouver for vacation you have to go to English Bay, Stanley Park, Robson street and entire west end neighborhood. This hotel has a perfect location to all these great places and more. You can walk to any wehre and any time ( downtown Vancouver is very safe and busy even after mid night ). The only thing that it may bother some crowd would be the fact that this hotel is located on a friendly Gay neighborhood! I am not gay so if it did not bother me at all why should u be battered?! oh one more great thing is Davie street is full of good restaurants. You can try any cousins for good price. From Sushi, Greek, Persian to Italian ........

Reviews.Title: “Well located and equipped”
Reviews.Author: travguy
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we had a week in Vancouver before a cruise and wanted the laundry and kitchen facilites - much prefer to cater my own breakfast. The rooms are compact but very well equipped - full kitchen including dishwasher and washer/dryer, sofa in living area and excellent, included internet access. I agree that the unit is not scrubbed clean daily but we are not messy so it was not an issue. We had a problem with locks that was dealt with and we found the front desk staff to be polite and helpful.. Lifts still tend to be slow at times - guess they need a new computer control system. As other have said, well located and bus stop 50 yards away. We were well satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, central location”
Reviews.Author: LHR_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a four night stay in July as it had a separate living / kitchenette area. We were not disappointed. The hotel is very centrally located in the gay neighbourhood of Vancouver - perfect for bar hopping as you don't need a cab ! There is a good selection of restaurants, cafes and bars nearby. In addition, there is a 24 hour drug store / small supermarket opposite the hotel which means that you can avail of having some creature comforts such as fresh muilk in your fridge and cereal for a late night snack. Staff were incredibly friendly which made our stay more comfortable. Would definitely consider this when next in Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Nice all suite hotel”
Reviews.Author: caraIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location for all parts of town. Walking distance to everything from Robson st, to Gastown, to stanley park. We were upgraded on arrival for an extra $10 a nite to a room with balcony and city view . Fully equipped kitchen , separate bedroom etc. Very clean. Hotel has pool and full spa facilities. Pool is nice but no atmosphere up there. Reception staff were really helpful. Parking is an extra $21a night which is a bit much . The area itself is the gay area of vancouver so be prepared for lots of gay bars etc and the "adult shops" accross the road . Vancouver itself seems a bit run down in parts and there are a lot of homeless people around . The hotel is near the hospital and for a lot of the night you will hear the ambulance and police sirens going . Also the AC is not very modern and is very noisy. So turn it on during the day when you are out - cos you wont sleep during the night with it on , between that and the sirens ............

Reviews.Title: “A great place as always”
Reviews.Author: johnnietravels
Reviews.Content: Just spend 1 night at this hotel but it was my 3rd stay here, other stays were 4-5 nights, and as usual was quite pleased with everything..On arrival my friend and myself were greeted by a warm welcome. Our room was on the 22nd and this gave us an amazing view, although I am afraid of heights, my friend loved it. The suite was very clean and well kept as usual. Very nice stay with the wonderful location. Very quiet in the hotel during our stay, noise from outside but you expect that in a city that size. One problem still remains though are those strange washer/ dryer machines, as I still cannot figure them out and others say the same.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: greenthumb2000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted a reasonably priced, nice, clean place that was well located, as we did not have a car. The Sandman Suites Davie was perfect! It is located in the West End, in a very interesting, cosmopolitan neighborhood. We could walk to English Bay, Stanley Park, Robson St, False Creek, Yaletown, The Granville Island aquabus, all within 10-15 minutes. The area is safe for walking at night, and is full of good ethnic restaurants, wonderful fruit & vegetable markets, bakeries, coffee houses, supermarkets, drug stores, etc. Everything you need is just outside the hotel. It is also on a main bus route, so getting around on public transit is easy. The hotel is clean, and the staff is friendly & helpful. The rooms have a full kitchen, but we were there to try the wonderful restaurants! It does give you the convenience of not eating every meal out. There is a pool ( I think!) and health club, sauna, etc., which we did not use. Also, free internet access, which did not work for us, but no big deal. There is also a nice looking restaurant, which we did not try. I would definitely stay here in the future, and recommend the Sandman Suites Davie to friends. Note, there is another Sandmnn property in town, so do not confuse the two. Enjoy, Greenthumb, S.J., Ca

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Adz99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in June and overall it was a good experience. We asked for a high floor room and they gave us one on the 23rd floor in the corner (dual aspect) which was fantastic with stunning views. When we returned the second time they already had us placed in the same room which was a nice touch. Rooms are spacious and clean, only negatives are that the place has been sort of refurbished but the bits they didnt do - mainly the bathroom - aren't that nice. There was a funny drain smell all the time in the bathroom and a few silverfish. The air con is ancient so very loud and not that efficient, but does the job. Windows are single glazed so you can hear the noise from the restaurants, buses and street below. The pool was nice, warm enough to swim in and bathed in afternoon sun. Steam room was also nice and free of charge. Some extra charges appeared on my credit card which were quickly sorted out and refunded. The best thing about the hotel is the staff. They couldn't do more to help you. That and the location. It's central to everything you want. the beach is only 10 min walk as are all the shops. Davie itself is vibrant although quite a few homeless. Dont let it bother you as they just mind their own business mostly, and Vancouver has this problem all over, not just on Davie. The best restaurant by far in the greek taverna (Stephos?) located about 25m from the hotel (turn right as you exit) there is always a long line outside, but join it - its well worth the 20 minute wait.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: PhillyMatt
Reviews.Content: My partner and I chose the Sandman because it is located in Vancouver's gay nighborhood, Davie Village. Everything we needed was within walking distance- bars, restaurants, coffee shops, pharmacy and the beach. The hotel itself was very nice. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are apartment style, with a kitchen, breakfast bar and living room. Ours had a spectacular view of the ocean and a balcony. The hotel's restaurant, Moxie's, was nice and the food was very good. I would highly recommend the Sandman.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: JoggingScots
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks - a combination of holidays and other commitments. It has a great location amidst really good restaurants, bars and shops. There's plenty of good fresh produce sold locally if you want to make the most of the suite kitchen too. Sure, there are a couple of 'adult' shops' across the street but they are pretty unobtrusive. We found it was very safe to walk around the area late at night (more than we can say for Granville Street!) The hotel itself was clean (I guess the hygiene issues have now been sorted) and comfortable with all the facilities we expected. The hotel staff were all friendly and helpful. The restaurant seemed a bit pricey but the hotel itself is very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very dodgy hygiene, great location”
Reviews.Author: SusDev
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in March 2008 for approximately 10 days. The hygiene at this hotel is dodgy at best. Management will state that it is done daily, but it is not. The rooms are not vacuumed, the bathroom is not cleaned properly (hair in bathtub daily), the kitchen is dusted (not cleaned) after the bathroom … with the same rag, and there were silverfish in the room (kitchen and bathroom). When confronted with the problems, the General Manager acted very defensively, and promised to investigate ‘if asked nicely’. The General Manager is NOT an asset to this hotel. She has no sense of customer service or people relations. She could use a lot of training. After her investigation was complete, she gave us a 25% discount for one night and promised to have hygiene restored. Again, out of the goodness of her heart. Following her investigation, ‘gift’, and promise to ensure that the hotel standards of cleanliness would be enforced, there was still hair in the bathtub … on the very same day. Finally, the Housekeeping Manager had to resort to cleaning the room personally, and was embarrassed by the whole situation (very nice and personable lady, by the way, an a REAL ASSET to the hotel). On the upside, the property is very conveniently located for anyone wishing to be in Downtown Vancouver. As well, the front desk personnel were generally pleasant to deal with and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive!”
Reviews.Author: westcoast_canada
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Sandman location several times now and it is definatly far superior to the other Sandman Hotel located across from GM Place. We had a nice city view room, which included a separate bedroom, kitchen, two tv's and a balcony. The room was clean and very well appointed, it was not luxurious but very clean and modern looking. The outdoor pool is very nice as well as the spa area. The staff were super friendly and the food at Moxies was great. The location is ideal if you are into Davie St. close to lots of restaurants, bars, and trendy shops. It is about a 15-20 minute walk to Robson St. shopping, and less than a 10 minute walk to English Bay beach. The view from the room was superb and I would recommend this property to anyone looking for a nice place to stay downtown that is not overly expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Perfect”
Reviews.Author: CASanMarino
Reviews.Content: I bought an airline vacation package. The hotel's express check-out papers wanted me to sign that I would pay the full hotel bill if the tour operator did not! I had paid in full for the package the month before. Maid service was minimal. Sheets not changed in four nights. Three light bulbs burned out. Coffee not re-stocked. The toilet needed plungering, but the maid ignored that. The heat had to be on 24 hours full blast to get the room warm enough. The elevators still don't work right -- a problem they have had for years. Shower temp did not hold steady. Mattress and pillows were very comfortable. The suite was built to rent as an apartment for one (or two). Lots of closet and storage space.

Reviews.Title: “Great views from our room”
Reviews.Author: nikkivn
Reviews.Content: We booke d here for the first night of our 3 week trip to the area, and the price seemed very reasonable for what we were getting, and it was! The suite gave us a great view over Stanley Park, the city and the water and the room was clean, compact and bijou. Probably the only thing we didn't like was the fact that the balcony was very unsafe for children and the door out to the balcony could easily be opened by our 2 year old. So safety was a bit of an issue here but otherwise the room was great. The reception was very funky and modern, and the staff helpful. Moxies was nice, except for the fire alarm!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Londres
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week at the Sandman Suites and was greatly impressed by the friendliness and helpfulness of ALL the staff, the ample kitchenette, two TVs in the suite, a washer/dryer, a dishwasher and internet connection. Everything has been thought of - an iron and ironing board, microwave, telephones in both rooms. The only bother was the breakdown of the internet connection for several days, but guests were allowed to use the business centre for free. Stayed here before and wouldn't want to stay anywhere else in Vancouver. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel !”
Reviews.Author: rbrt9999
Reviews.Content: We had booked another hotel, but when we arrived it was unsuitable. The manager recommended SANDMAN SUITES ON DAVIES and called for a reservation. We loved the hotel ! Our room had a small kitchenette, and a balcony overlooking English Bay. Everyone at the hotel were so very nice and helpfull. We will always stay at this hotel when we are in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice suite, noisy aircon”
Reviews.Author: kwenga
Reviews.Content: The suite was quite spacious, lobby and check-in also quite good. Everything (bath, kitchen, bedroom) very clean, the bed comfy, but I was glad we didn't have to use the aircondition. We switched it on, and it was super noisy (you don't hear the street sounds any more, though). The whole building is a bit dated, esp. the windows are old and don't keep any noise out. The area is ok, lots of cafes and restaurants around, location convenient for any downtown things you might want to see.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, friendly, affordable suites”
Reviews.Author: JamesPShaw
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Sandman for 4 days while on a three week trip to the west coast of BC. The location is spot on for exploring the downtown area on foot and is also very close to most of the major bus lines that will bring you to the attractions in the Greater Vancouver area. Davie Village itself has a lot to offer including some very good restaurants and cafes that are just a step away from the front door of the hotel. The hotel is beginning to look somewhat dated on the outside but inside, the lobby is a modern, welcoming place. Possibly the hotel's strongest point are its staff, who are easily the friendliest, most helpful I've come across in any hotel I've stayed in. We upgraded to a cityview room on arrival (for an extra $30) and would recommend it for the views of the city, particularly at night. Being up on the higher floors probably kept things a little quieter too as Davie would get busy late in the evenings on the weekends. The room allocated to us was on the 22nd floor and was very clean, if a little dated in parts. However, a pretty comfy bed, ample complimentary toiletries and nice, soft towels make up for any other shortcomings (the bathroom is on the small side but not unmanageable). Internet access worked instantly and efficiently and was more than fast enough for everyday emailing and browsing needs. Housekeeping called each day and did as good a job as one would expect and replenished towels and toiletries. The rates are very competitive with other downtown hotels and, although the hotel is not necessarily cheap, it is after all, a hotel in downtown Vancouver and, as such, a hotel in downtown Vancouver will never be what one might describe as "cheap"! Finally, a word on the district: Davie Village is Vancouver's gay area but this shouldn't put people off. As is the way with Vancouver generally, the city manages to envelope all creeds, races and sexual preferences with great ease and candour, and Davie Village is a good example of this. As for the hotel being "surrounded" by adult shops (as was noted by a previous reviewer), I can't say that I'd agree. Overall, its a good option for well-located accommodation at what is the lower end of the price bracket.

Reviews.Title: “Subpar Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: itsneverserious
Reviews.Content: Do not let the sleek, modern looking lobby fool you, this hotel is not at all what they advertise. The ceilings are very low and the hotel overall is in a ratty condition. First and foremost, housekeeping is not done on a daily basis here! Yuck, especially with a kitchen. The cleaners come and spend at most 5-8 minutes in the room. They spray some solution on the kitchen floor and make up the bed, and refresh the towels. I watched one day while she came in because I was wondering why my room had visible food stains in the kitchen, why the floor did not appear to be vacuumed and the ceramic floor was left dirty! For $200 a night, this is unacceptable! The stove was never cleaned off during my stay and I had to strip the bed of its sheets so they would be changed. The bathroom is about the smallest I have ever seen, only one person can fit in and it is a very tight squeeze and you are forced to back into the toilet just to close the door. Towels are rough and the shower pressure doesn't adjust to a gentle stream or mist, did I mention how small the bathroom is? The room showed noticeable signs of wear and tear, the furniture was ratty and the kitchen table and chairs were so cheap they seemed suitable for a 1st grade playset. The fridge, microwave and dishwasher are all modern and it is nice to have a kitchen in the room. The laundry machine is a European model which worked well, albeit takes some time. I had an oceanview room and the view is stunning, but the windows are so filthy you need to open the balcony door to enjoy it...the balcony was a nice touch. The living area is tight and the sofabed is only a twin and opens up directly into the desk/TV area, so no one can sit at the desk if the sofabed is pulled out. The complimentary internet connection here is wired and its very slow and I had to constantly restart it to get it to work. Quite annoying. Parking is $18.75 a day for valet and they were reasonably quick with the car (there is parking about a block away on Davie for $20 or so for 5 days. The entrance to the hotel is in a back alley and is very dangerous because there is a blind curve and when you enter, you can't see who exits, so you must move very slowly. The business center charges for internet access. The location is very good, I walked to Granville Island, downtown and Stanley Park and there are numerous affordable eating options along Davie Street (which is the gay center of Vancouver). Contrary to most reviews, I would not recommend staying here unless it was less than $100 a night, they should advertise that they do not do a full housekeeping during the course of your stay and charge accordingly. Kudos to the front desk staff who are quite friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: disneyfan75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel the first week in September and absolutely loved this hote. Yes, it was a small suite but for our needs it was absolutely perfect. The hotel is in a great location to walk to restaurants for dinner and with the kitchenette you were able to bring home left overs if necessary. It is also located down the street from a small market and a market for fruits and vegetables. This was nice for my husband and I as we were able to get supplies for breakfast and save on money of eating out. The room was clean and housekeeping cleaned it up every morning while we were out. We also were upgraded from a queen sized city view room to a king sized ocean view room and the view from our room was just amazing. There is a cost for parking every night. However, it does include valet service for your car which was very nice. My only complaint regarding this is that I wish they would have published this rate on their site prior to our arrival so we could have planned better. Overall, our stay was fabulous and definitely would stay at this location again when we are in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: ed30
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August for the our first trip to Vancouver. Great location for bars and restaurants, ten minutes walk from English Bay Beach. Staff very helpful, rooms clean and the kitchens are well stocked. This is very handy if you take a doggy bag from a restaurant. Davie Street can be busy at night but the hotel is well away from the noise. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - great view”
Reviews.Author: Pitch_the
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Sandman Davie. The room was good with a great view from the outside balcony - Stanley Park (10 min walk) and the City (15-20 min walk). Location is lively, loads of restaurants/cafes within walking distance. C Restaurant was a ten min walk and Bin 941 Restaurant was a 5 min walk - both are highly recommended! Room itself had a separate sitting room / kitchen but the decor is a bit dated and probably in need of a revamp. We did have a problem with the sheets and duvet cover on our first night - the sheets were laundered but still had dark spot stains on them and the duvet cover had large coffee stains all over it. This was at midnight but the valet was sent up to change the sheets and the manager offered us free breakfasts for the duration of our stay as an apology for the lack of care. Other than that instance, we found the room to be clean. The breakfast was very good and can be taken up to a leisurely 2pm at the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: calpe
Reviews.Content: Booked a a per-cruise stay, although about 15 minutes from main shopping area, a great place to stay. Staff friendly, room excellent. One night was a bit noisey from other room occupants and telling reception offered a free breakfast as an apology.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, dont mind the junkie tenants”
Reviews.Author: Pathcontrolmonk
Reviews.Content: I knew of this hotel and stayed at it previously when it was called the Park Hill. While the views may be spectacular, so are the views from every other Downtown Hotel over 10 stories. The room may be a suite but originally they were just big hotel rooms so now it is just a cramped suite. Nevermind that the hotel staff were completely disorganized, half the people (actually it may have been more) lined up at check-in were complaining about something, our room key didnt work, and you had to wait for the elevator door to half close 3x times before it would start to move. The truly troubling thing were the Long-term tenants staying there. I shared the elevator with no less than 2 strung out junkies (you need a room key to use the elevator so they were staying there too), one of whom was so wild eyed that a British couple shielded their child from her with their bodies. If you are a backpacker on a budget perhaps I would recommend, but you can get much better rooms for better prices without having to share a hotel with heroin addicts.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: CandiceS
Reviews.Content: I've seen and stayed in many places, and this city and hotel are unquestionably in my Top 3. We came to Vancouver for a couple days in July and stayed at the Sandman on Davie. We had a suite on the 18th floor and WHAT A VIEW! I had not previously seen Van from so high up, and it was simply breathtaking. We spent a fair amount of time on the balcony just enjoying the view (despite the rain, which was not a surprise) and especially the neon sign from the restaurant below us which made us laugh ( part of which read "Do you smell burnt toast...then you are probably having a stroke") and definitely got points for originality. The suite itself was fantastic - so nice to have something more than the regulation bedroom/bathroom. We had people over more than once and they also commented on how nice the place was, and convenient with the living/dining area - it can be awkward when you have people over to your hotel room and the only place they can sit is on the bed... the couch and chairs were essential and totally came in handy. I LOVED the kitchenette, and the dishwasher (big bonus points)..it was great to have the option to make our own food if we didn't feel like going out. As for the major issues found with any hotel stay - the suite was very clean and well maintained; staff were friendly and helpful; the location is central and we walked mostly everywhere we went; and most importantly - we could not hear a peep from the people above, below, or beside us. The decor in the main areas of the hotel and in our suite was very nice, and there was also plenty of room for storing clothes/coats/shoes etc. The only small drawback we encountered was parking - the valet couldn't park the standard vehicle we had brought, and actually called up to our room to ask us to come back down and park it for him. Then the next day when we asked for the car to be brought out front for us, we waited out front for about 15 minutes before going in to the front desk where they just handed us the keys. (!) This was not a huge deal to us but was something that came as a small surprise. After that we just parked in another lot down the street (about 2 minutes' walk away) - which ended up costing less than the valet anyway. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel as a wicked good choice if you're having a visit/extended stay in Van. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views”
Reviews.Author: Balix
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through an agent for a two night post-cruise stay in Vancouver. It was one of the cheaper options but we were assured it was a good standard and the fact it was a suite as opposed to a room swayed our decision. On arrival there was a mix up in the booking and we were hastily allocated a room on the seventeenth floor which afforded great views over the city and beyond to the mountains and the sea. The reception staff could not have been nicer. We were told that this room represented an upgrade but to be honest it didn't seem much different to rooms that the rest of our party were staying in on the eighth floor save for a slightly bigger bed. However, it was good enough if a little bit of a squeeze when the sofa bed was out. The bathroom was well supplied with toiletries though the towels were on the thin side. The attached Moxies restaurant was a hit with all our party and there are several others in the immediate neighbourhood to choose from as well. Just one point about that neighbourhood, though. The hotel is situated right in the middle of Davie Village which is Vancouver's gay area. It was surrounded by a number of adult shops displaying merchandise that some might find offensive. We had no problems with it but families with young children night want to take this into consideration. The downtown area of Vancouver is pretty compact and the hotel is within a short walk of most of it. If you want luxury choose somewhere else but if you just want a reasonable room and are happy with the location, the Sandman Suites are worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: haverty
Reviews.Content: My teenaged daughter and I spent 5 nights at the Sandman Suites. We had asked in a note on our reservations for the best room/view we could get without paying extra and we got a lovely room on the 23rd floor. The suite with full kitchen was an excellent value. Everyone, from the front desk to the maid service was friendly and helpful. The location was perfect. Many good restaurants and grocers nearby, and walking distance to ferries and busses to everywhere else. The only negative was that the free wireless didn't work in the front room, but when I plugged it in in the bedroom it did. It would have been nice to do my computer work at the desk instead of the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly a great stay”
Reviews.Author: aurorayt
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location. The restaurant "Moxies" that the hotel uses was very noisy with "ok" food. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. The price was not bad for summer and right downtown. The washers and driers in the room were a nightmare. It was actually one unit that washed and dried but it took forever to finish if you actually could figure out how to get it all going. The hotel has a wonderful spa that gives the best pedicures in the world. I would stay here again as the room was very comfortable and the staff great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: oceanlover0327
Reviews.Content: Spent one week at the Sandman Suites on Davie, from 9-16 July 2007. I booked a one bedroom suite.
