The room was on the 10th floor, and although it was described as a "city view suite" it also had a partial view of English Bay which was a very nice surprise! The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. Room was clean. Housekeeping always did a good job (only complaint is that the bath towels are too small). Kitchen was clean, modern and well equiped. The hotel also has a spa, outdoor pool and restaurant called Moxie's; I did not try any of them but they all looked appealing. Vancouver is a lovely, vibrant city. The hotel was perfectly located, in the West End of downtown but in a "real" neighborhood. Davie Street has lots of coffeeshops, internet cafes, restaurants, grocery stores and organic markets. It's the gay neighborhood, but open and welcoming to all, I felt very safe there as a single female. Cobs Bread adjacent to the hotel was a great place to pick up croissants and fresh baked bread/pastries. The hotel was perfectly located. Loved walking down Davie street and finding myself at English Bay beach and the western edge of Stanley Park. I walked all over downtown, no need for a car. If I return to Vancouver, I would definitely stay at the Sandman Suites on Davie again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: JennyDeltaBC
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful (if short!) stay at the Sandman on Davie. Compared to many downtown hotels, the rooms at the Sandman are definitely priced at the low end of the scale, and because of this, when I made my room reservation I was expecting a somewhat shabby family-style hotel with tired and worn decor and mininal amenities. I was SO wrong! I was welcomed into a very swish lobby that felt a bit like a trendy night spot. The wonderful staff at the front desk have somehow managed to find that magical balance between professionalism and genuine friendliness. I was quickly checked in by someone who truly seemed happy to be there! I stayed in a suite on the 21st floor with an absolutely jaw-dropping view of the West End, English Bay, Stanley Park, and the North Shore mountains. The suite had been recently renovated and featured cherry-coloured laminate flooring, a stylish kitchen with breakfast bar and black appliances, and fabulous plumbing fixtures. I wasn't expecting to find deliciously thick robes in the closet, in-suite laundry, and enough storage space to keep a small family happy for a week. I also wasn't expecting to find that the Sandman would have so many excellent facilities. The pool and the patio around it are just lovely. The pool change areas are gorgeous - all dark woods, with slate tiles and soft lighting. And there is an amazing looking spa (if you're into that - it's not my thing so I didn't go in), and a smallish but extremely well-equipped fitness room. I am a personal trainer, and I am used to shaking my head in bewilderment when some hotels claim to have a fitness room, but all that's in it is an elliptical and a treadmill. But this fitness centre rocks! Great selection of free weights, a couple of adjustable benches, decent range of machines, two BOSU's, body balls of various sizes, lots of stretching mats, medicine balls... it's just great!!! And there's no additional charge to use it! Oh yeah, and they have half a dozen cardio machines. But I would strongly recommend a run along the Stanley Park seawall Seawall instead - it's a runner's paradise :) I only stayed at the Sandman for one night to watch the HSBC Celebration of Lights (fireworks show), but as I drove away, I felt calm, serene, and happy. I was as though I had really been on a holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Honest review sandman suite davie and surrounding area”
Reviews.Author: ilovetotravelme
Reviews.Content: Great value for money. We had a 18th floor king size suite facing the ocean, balcony present for those who don't suffer from vertigo. Washing machine, fridge freezer, good cooking facilities, dishwasher (with powder) and decent shower.Hotel staff very helpful and friendly. Just ask, if you require transport or tourist info, if they don't know they'll find it on the internet. Lounge/ kitchen area spacious, carpet a bit grubby. Bed comfortable and big. Tv's in lounge and bedroom. Overall very comfortable. Location great for food, some bars had great atmosphere although drinking coffee seems to be more of a Vancouver past time than drinking booze , a Starbucks or equivalent on every street corner - no exaggeration. Highly recommend Granville market, if you can name every single fruit you see you must work there!! Try a Dragon fruit or a Persimmon. Buy an oyster shucker and a dozen oysters from the Lobster man shop sit on a bench and enjoy the view on the marina, and tuck in with surreptitious bottle of vino blanco.

Reviews.Title: “great neighbourhood, good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GSnail
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is it's location. Right in the middle of restaurants and green grocers, there are always tons of hipsters around. It's also just a few blocks from the ocean and I walked to Stanley park everyday. Fun! The hotel itself was strange, but good. The lobby is ultra-modern and has the ambiance of a club. This led me to the belief that the rooms would be similarly sexy. The rooms turned out to be very neutral and reminded me of the 80's, but were very clean and large. I like the washer/dryer. Tres handy. My room had a nice patio that overlooked the pool with a truly great view of the mountains. I like watching tv before bed and was very happy that there are not one, but two, count em, two tvs!!! One in the living room and one in the bedroom. Our room was always clean and the staff were very helpful. Conclusion: I liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Silly_Snoopy
Reviews.Content: Sandman Suites Davie is a very nice stay for us. My wife and I bring our 1 year old with us, having a sofa bed and a seperate bedroom works great. Also, a full working kitchen is a vey handy feature. The staff were very good, very helpful. Valet parking is same price as self park, so take advantage of that if you have a car. The room is clean, modern. For the price, it is a very good stay for us. I really like the area we are staying. Yeah, there were some X-rated store in the area, but hey, just keep an open mind and you will be fine. It is a short stroll to the water front, good for a relaxing walk. There were lots of restaurant choices. Robson Street is a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Easy livin' at the Sandman”
Reviews.Author: Gingerlocks
Reviews.Content: I researched Vancouver BC hotels on TripAdvisor for a work trip in mid-February. I kept going back to the Sandman Suites Davie as the reviews were so positive and the rates met my business travel budget. The Sandman did not disappoint. The staff was friendly and accomodating; the room had an amazing view; the spa was fantastic. If you're looking for a hotel that gives you the freedom to cook your own meals if you choose, but puts in the heart of all the action when you want it. This is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money!”
Reviews.Author: bunkamura
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd trip in two months to Vancouver and the first at Sandman Suites. I have traveled internationally for more than 20 years and can say without doubt that this hotel was the best value for money I have ever experienced. The accomodations are not five star, but then again you are not paying for 5 star accomondations. However: - the bed was very comfortable - the room was clean and well cleaned daily by housekeeping - all items (tv, oven, dishwasher, washing machine/dryer, microwave) worked well - I have read some complaints here about the difficulty of using the combined washer/dryer and the length of time - anyone, however, who uses/has used an European machine will be able to figure out how it works - one kitchen cabinet hinge was broken and was repaired within two hours - fitness center was not busy and had up to date equipment - staff were friendly and helpful - the only negative item I would say about the hotel was the slow speed of the (free!) high speed internet. OK for e-mail; too slow for large documents. There are cheap internet services in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Eurotravel
Reviews.Content: We booked a room based on the positive reviews, and we were not disappointed. It has a full, modern kitchen with all the pots, pans, dishes, etc., you could ever need. The bedroom and bathroom are a little snug, but the living-dining-kitchen area tends to make up for it. It was clean and nicely decorated. Lots of grocery stores nearby to stock the kitchen. We were looking forward to the washing machine since we'd been on the road for a few days. It is a "european" machine, which I guess means only the staff can make it work. It is both a washer and a dryer in one. It didn't dry the clothes, so we had to hang them around the room. Not quite what we had hoped for, but perhaps better than having to leave the room for a laundry room in the basement or paying for the service. We had dinner at the Moxie the first night. It was quite nice, the food was good and it looks out on the street. The area around the hotel kind of blew our minds--in a good way. Full of xrated stores, ethnic restaurants, and eccentric characters. The "host" at the Indian restaurant across the steet reminded us of one of the actors in the movie The Birdcage. He was wearing a turban and in drag. It was quite an unexpected cultural experience. We were not charged for parking, so maybe that policy has changed. Overall, a very good location and accomodation. Be sure to join their senior program if you are 55 or older, you'll save quite a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: rivana
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother during october, on a visit to see my sister and her family. My first impression was that the room was a little small, but for the time we spent there it wasn't a problem. Mum had the bedroom and i had the sofa bed, both were comfortable and the sofa bed was easy to assemble, though she did say the bed was a little too firm for her liking. The room was just like a home from home and was equipped with everything you would need for a self catering holiday (microwave, stove, coffee maker, kettle, toaster, washer dryer and fridge with ice compartment), though it's such good value to eat out that we tended to only use the toaster in the morning. The rooms also have two televisions, which was handy. The house keeping was excellent as was the room service when we ordered some drinks. The front desk staff were friendly and informative, and i'd happily stay here again. The location was good and despite the area having a reputation as the "gay" district we saw more mixed than same sex couples. Shopping on Davie st is limited but Robson st is close by and easily reached on foot. For those people wishing to visit the tourist attractions, the hotel has a handy touch screen guide in the lobby providing information on all the nearby attractions, and taxi's are always outside to get you there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Plan4U
Reviews.Content: Before we went, I read several reviews indicating that the hotel rooms looked a little "tired." This was NOT the case for my room or the two others I booked for family members. The rooms were fantastic...loved the separate sitting room. The views from our floors (14 and 15) were exceptional whether we were on the city side or the water side, though I must say that the sunset over the water our first night was simply unbeatable. The staff, from the maid to the front desk, was excellent. Indeed, they remembered your name when you came downstairs and that simply doesn't happen that often these days. We had both one dinner and one breakfast in the hotel restaurant.....money and time well spent. Best of all was the location. This is a very vibrant part of town...always something going on and within walking distance of the entire downtown area. I would readily recommend this hotel to anyone. The fact that this is the first review I've ever written is evidence of my enthusiasm.

Reviews.Title: “Good solid value for money”
Reviews.Author: Amdamguy
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at this hotel. This visit was better than the first, because of the completed gym and health spa located on the 3rd floor. The gym itself is small but very well appointed with aerobic equipment, free weights and machines. All equipment is of very high quality. We were impressed and all was included in the rate. We found the front desk staff very friendly upon check in and check out. Fast and efficient. We paid a little more this time for a room on the 18th floor with a view of the ocean...What a view! The suite was somewhat small, for more than 2 people. 3 people might find it a bit of a squeeze, but then again, how much time do you spend in the room. We found the bathroom smaller than you would find in other hotels. The hotel is located in a trendy part of Vancouver, away from some of the seediness of Granville street. The hotel is a very easy walk to alot of the shopping in Vancouver. Granville Island is close by. If you are not in a hurry, you are can also walk to Stanley Park; its a little bit of a walk 30-40 minutes or so...but you can also catch a bus which will take you there. They have a free internet connection available in the room as well, which was a little slow at times...but for reading email, it was fine. I would definately stay here again. Compared to other hotels in the area, I question if you will find the same value for money, especially if you book one of the lower internet rates available at the Sandman website.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mlom
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent one night, but I would happily return to this hotel because of the fair price, friendly staff, clean suite and great location - Stanley Park and the ferry to Granville Island are within walking distance and there's a great little bakery just two doors down. The neighborhood is just funky enough to be interesting without being totally over-the-top.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and GREAT location!!”
Reviews.Author: prettyangel687
Reviews.Content: I loved the sandman! it was great with a super great price to match. When we arrived we were on the 18th floor and they upgraded us to the 22nd floor. They said it was a bit bigger. The bedroom and bathroom is small but it wasnt a big deal to me at all. Came with cooking pots, pans, silverware, ect. DONT park in their parking lot. They charge $18 A DAY to park! If you do down to the parkign lot by the Value Save market, its like $35 for 5 days or something like that. Either way you will save tons of money. Its only a block away! If you are facing the front entrance of the hotel, it is on your right side across the street, adjacent to the Value save, you wont miss it. They cleaned our room everyday and we never had to call them. Great location with a starbucks and a cobb bread store (yum), and plenty of restaurants around. Very convient spot in my opinion and i would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: futuredolphin
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. OK, so the rooms are a little small, but they're very clean, and having a full kitchen and washer/dryer is a big plus. The hotel staff was wonderful - friendly, helpful, and informative. Didn't eat at Moxie's, but did enjoy a nice glass of wine there on a couple of occasions, and the service was just fine. What makes this place such a great spot is the neighborhood. Hip, funky, and very, very interesting! Right next door is an organic grocery, really good restaurants of every ethnicity abound, coffee shops on every corner, the sex toy store is just across the street, head shop is next door on the other side, boutiques of all types, you name it! It's also within walking distance to Stanley Park, English Bay, Robson St ., and Granville Island. So, if you're not put off by a "gay neighborhood" and aren't offended by window displays of sexual devices or drug paraphernelia, but do love good food, walking in a beautiful city, and enjoy a funky neighborhood atmosphere, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great space”
Reviews.Author: GVTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the 23rd floor with a good friend and we loved it. It was clean and modern. We did like having a full kitchen with dishwasher and microwave as well as fridge and stove/oven. There are great delis and a grocery store nearby--but what's with no wine at the store? One comment on the washing machine/dryer combo--it was my first time using one and better instructions could be given and warning the complete cycle time is rather long (about 4 hours). Great view, but we had to drag the office or dining chairs out if we wanted to sit on the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities”
Reviews.Author: UrbanAngel5
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel while travelling with my boyfriend and a friend. It was great because the rooms are suites so my boyfriend and I were able to go into the bedroom and close the door while my friend had the sofabed. It was the perfect solution because we were all able to stay together but no one was made to feel uncomfortable. The other great thing about these suites was that they had a washing machine. We were just about to embark on a 3 week coach tour changing hotels every night so it was great to get all our clothes clean before the tour began. Only downside was that the hotel did not provide washing powder. We had powder for the dishwasher but I think this was left behind by the previous occupants! Having a kitchen also kept costs down as we were able to prepare our own food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bay View”
Reviews.Author: javaman1960
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights at the Sandman Suites on Davie Street in Vancouver's West End. The location in Davie Village is convenient to everything in the downtown area and is within walking distance of all major attractions. We were lucky enough to have a "bay view" suite (all rooms are suites) on the 18th floor with a fantastic view of English Bay and a "peek view" of Stanley Park. This vantage point made watching the annual fireworks competition especially nice. Rooms on a lower floor may not have as nice a view. The suites were renovated a few years ago, with what appears to be IKEA cabinets/furnishings. But the color schemes and choices are very contemporary and upscale looking. The suite was small, but everything functioned well. The kitchen was stocked with basic cookware, flatware and dishes. Oddly enough, there were no paper towels or facial tissues in the suite, so we had to buy some at a nearby grocery store. The pool was nicely maintained, but we did not use the fitness facility or spa, so we cannot comment on it. We did enjoy the attached restaurant (Moxie's) and lounge. It seemed like an average value, and the food and drinks were quite good. The balconies have no furniture, so if you have folding chairs for the fireworks, use them on your balcony (as we did). The staff was, without exception, extremely friendly and helpful. The elevators did seem slow to come during peak times, and sometimes seemed frustrating for guests. If you like staying in suites, then this might well be a great place to stay. It was a little small for an extended stay, but was fine for a week or less. There is a washer/dryer in the suite, but we didn't ever try to use it. As I got a very competitive rate for this suite, I feel it was a very good value, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modest, Bland and Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reg_Woods
Reviews.Content: Small bland rooms that should be avoided in heat wave. The room air conditioners are loud and do not keep the rooms cool in 90 F weather. If you are near the ice machine you will hear it all night long. Bathrooms are tiny and have few towels. In suite laundry machine is hard to figure out. All-in-one machine converts from washer to dryer. Ask the bell hop how to work it as the instruction in the room are not clear. My reservations were mixed up and I ended up on the fourth floor (Note: lower rates below the 10th floor). Room below the tenth have no view. Parking is extra. Overall a very average hotel. Nothing special. Location is good, close to English Bay and in a gay area of Vancouver. Nice bakery and ice cream place nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Sandman Suites on Davie is a great place to stay for anyone looking for a great location in Vancouver. It is clean, modern, and has great service. While we were there, some unusual things happened (no water and broken elevator) during the busy Canada Day weekend. Despite these issues ( I had to wash my feet in the kitchen sink), I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and I will definetely stay at this hotel in the future!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had 6 nights at the Sandman Suites on Davie this June. The location is excellent, walking distance to most Vancouver attractions, shops and restaurants very close by. The rooms are good with a kitchen, lounge area, bedroom and bathroom. All very well equipped, including a washer/dryer and ironing board. Only a couple of faults, like much of Canada do not expect a plug for the bath and the swimming pool is outside - cold even in June!

Reviews.Title: “Not great for large families”
Reviews.Author: FamilySD
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 nights at the Sandman Suites at the end of a weeklong stay in Whistler, B.C. I think this hotel is ideal for single travelers, couples, or a family with 1 young child. The units are much too small for a family of 4-6. Balconies are scary for young children. Kitchen table seats 2 people only. It is great in that it has a washer/dryer and full kitchen, but bathrooms are tiny, living space is tight. The valet named Jay is invaluable! He directed us to fabulous restaurants for our family, gave us good insight to walking the city and always remembered our name when we entered the hotel. So we don't recommend this for families I think other suites hotels (ex. Residence Inn) are probably bigger in room size. But this is a good choice for other travelers who want an extended stay with apartment type amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good amenities”
Reviews.Author: Austin-1975
Reviews.Content: I reviewed nearly every 3-5 star Vancouver hotel on TripAdvisor before finally selecting Sandman Suites Davie. We were looking for something under $200/night in a convenient area with amenities that would allow for us not to have to dine out for every meal. Though our 'city view' room on the 8th floor did not have a spectacular view, it was okay -- with a view of the Davie area. We were going to ask to move up a few floors until the fire alarm went off and we had to walk down the stairs. The staff kept those of us wandering around outside the lobby doors informed and we were impressed to see a letter of apology from management posted on the inside of the elevators just shortly after the "all-clear" was given. As some other reviewers have noted, the elevators were VERY slow, the alley entrance was not entirely desirable, and sometimes the cleaning staff forgot to replace towels. But, generally the room was clean (and I'm very picky), the front-desk staff were friendly and helpful, and valet personnel were efficient. Our suite had a small kitchen with refrigerator, stove, microwave, kettle, dishware, utensils, etc. Very convenient. There were some very loud guests on our floor one night, but we did not attempt to get hotel staff to remedy the situation, so can't really complain about that. Location to sights was very good... we were able to walk to many of our destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: stuart3368
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and diverse neighborhood that we really enjoyed. The hotel itself is ok. The rooms were clean, although they did not get around to making up our room until 6 pm one day. The first night there were loud people on our floor at 3am. The manager came up a number of times before it ended. They do have washer/dryer in room that we used, but expect it to take about a day a load! There are plenty of places to each and drink, we ate at Stepho's right near by and was worth the wait in line! Again we really enjoyed Davie Village. From this hotel you can walk just about everywhere in Vancouver. Just be careful walking from gastown to chinatown. Lots of sketchy druggy people.

Reviews.Title: “Great location nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: begoldbelair
Reviews.Content: Not a luxury hotel by any means but very practical. Located on Davie Street a very hip location with lots of restaurants and bars. Easy walk to all downtown tourist spots and the Washer&dryer made it a great stop between our Cruise ship schedules. Staff was very helpful and we would stay there anytime we need to be in Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Modern facilities and good location”
Reviews.Author: Sienna293
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for five nights and were very pleased with our room, which contained very modern and well maintained facilities. The hotel is in a good location, in the city yet close to the beach, so an ideal location for exploring on foot. The kitchen contained an oven/hobs, microwave, full-size fridge/freezer, dishwasher, kettle, coffee maker, cutlery, crockery, pots and pans, dish cloths, dishwashing liquid and dishwashing powder. There was also a washer/dryer which enabled us to wash some clothes in the privacy of our own room (although you will have to provide your own laundry liquid). There was a breakfast bar, with chairs which separated the kitchen from the living room. The living room contained a sofa, coffee table and television. There was also a balcony connected to the living room, offering views of the city and the mountains. The bedroom was small, although it contained another television and a decent sized wardrobe (in addition to the wardrobe in the kitchen/living room). The bathroom contained a bath and a shower attached to the wall (not hand-held). The concierge was very helpful and he booked us an excellent tour to Grouse Mountain and Capilano Suspension Bridge, and he was even reluctant to accept a tip! Although overall we were pleased with our stay, there are a couple of minor criticisms. The housekeeping staff were not very thorough, for example, they did not empty the bins in the bathroom and did not clean the bath daily. They would also remove towels and dish cloths without replacing them. However, reception were very quick to replace the towels on request. The lifts were extremely slow, and staff also using these lifts further slowed down the system. There were occasions when a lift stopped, and we could not enter the lift because there was a member of staff inside with several bags of dirty laundry or similar, and there was no room for us inside the lift because of this. So we would have to wait several minutes for another lift to arrive and hope that there was room for us inside. However, the lifts also offer a security system in that a guest must insert their key card before pressing the floor number, in order to prevent those who are not guests at the hotel from gaining access. On arrival at the hotel our room was not ready (we arrived at 2pm), and although the receptionist was doing her best, we had to wait one hour before our room was available, which is not an ideal situation after a long journey. I find it hard to believe that they could not find one room available to us considering the size of the hotel. The bakery over the road (Sweet Success) offers a large selection of tempting goods. However, I purchased a sweet pastry and after eating half of the pastry, I discovered a live insect crawling underneath. I returned to the bakery two days later and the person behind the counter asked me to point out what I had purchased, and she was surprised herself to find several insects crawling around on the pastries and inside the tray. I was not expecting to find any insects there two days later! The drugmart opposite the hotel is a good place to do your food shopping, and here you can obtain maple syrup and maple cream cookies for less than you would expect to pay for these items in a tourist/gift shop. The farmers market a couple of doors away from the hotel, offers a wide selection of fresh, organic produce at reasonable prices. Granville Island is a good place to visit for souvenirs and gifts, if you want to get away from the typical tacky tourist shops! The Public Market contained several stands including, fresh meat, groceries, bakeries, gifts, as well as take-away food. There was a very nice Chinese take-away and the prices were reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Vancouver Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KINGKONG3
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in a great area of Vancouver. Downtown is a 10-15 min walk away, it's on the bus route and there's lots of shops and restaurants around. The hotel itself is very new and well maintained, the suite is perfect for anyone who wants to save a bit of money on food, or do their own laundry. Very comfortable bed, and friendly staff. Would have no hesitation in reccommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location , good staff , good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: David-H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Sandman for eight nights at the beginning of May. The hotel is in a great location with all major downtown attractions within reasonable walking distance. There's a nice bakery and market a couple of doors away and plenty other stores close by. (I suppose some people might be put off by the adult store across the road). The staff were all excellent , knowledgeable on the city and always helpful. I would recommend that you get a room on a higher floor. We were on the seventh floor and did get a little bother from traffic noise and the sound of dumpsters in the alley being emptied early in the morning. We also didn't have too much of a view. My only (admittedly small) quibble was with the blinds in the bedroom which didn't quite fill the window , leaving a gap that allowed the early morning sun to shine right across our faces. Still , it stopped us sleeping in ! Loved Vancouver and when we inevitably return would definitely stay at The Sandman again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value, we LOVE VANCOUVER!”
Reviews.Author: starladear
Reviews.Content: After living in Vancouver for nearly 18months, we needed a place to stay the last couple of nights before heading back home. We were happy at this hotel. Nice sized rooms, with kitchenette and balcony. Staff were friendly and compared to other hotels in Vancouver- the price is good value. Great to have the restuarant chain Moxies downstairs (I'm obsessed with their bellinis!). I loved the location in downtown, its close to shops, yaletown, false creek, english bay and stanley park. However some people who are more challenged in the walking department might find some locations of stanley park, robson st, coal harbour and gas town a bit too far to walk from this hotel (not me tho! - nearly all locals walk from A to B in Vancouver). But public transport is not an issue in Vancouver (well some what). ENJOY BEAUTIFUL VANCOUVER!

Reviews.Title: “Will ALWAYS stay at Sandman Suites Davie”
Reviews.Author: Deborah66
Reviews.Content: Stayed there April 15-20, 2006. Originally booked a queen suite, but was upgraded to a king suite with ocean view (room 2210) as our original room was not ready when we checked in. Upgrade was amazing. 22nd floor and the view could not have been any better. We had sunsets and a view of English Bay. Staff is pretty good especially the valet, concierge guys and bar staff (in Moxie's). Jay (concierge?) was extrememly friendly and helpful. Housekeeping took terrific care of us and we have no complaints whatsoever about our stay. The Moxie's restaurant that is attached has fantastic food and the "Tropicana" drink (moxie size it) was my favorite. It's a fun and very busy neighborhood, but go with an open mind as Davie is an active gay community. If this is an issue for you - stay somewhere other than Davie. Everyone we met was friendly and helpful. It's also a 24 hour street so there is a 24 hour grocery and Shoppers Drug Mart within one block, which was very convenient. We ate breakfast in our suite and one dinner which we prepared. Otherwise there are so many terrific restaurants nearby that you want to take advantage of. I will always return to the area and the hotel whenever an opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: ormester
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of the outside of the hotel was just okay. It looks kinda old and dirty from the outside. Once you get inside from the main door, it is beautiful. Very modern decor. If you are entering from the side so you can park in the 14.00CAN a night secured parking deck, you have to cut down a back alley and dodge the dumpsters and other oncoming cars. That was kinda bad to me. Upon entering the parking deck, you have to use your room key to open the gate. I do like the fact that your car is secure. Upon entering the elevator, you have to wait what seems like forever for the elevator to come down to the parking level, you have to also use your room key to operate the elevator. The room keys sometimes don't work, so you have to keep going to the lobby to get a new one. The rooms are small but have everything that you need. They are modern and up to date. The carpet was a little stained though. We liked the fact that we had a washer/ dryer combo. The thing was a little hard to figure out though. Just a reminder, it takes aprox. 3 hrs for 1 load to wash and dry. The rooms do NOT have hi-speed internet unless you rent a hi-speed modem for 4.99CAN a night. This is for the room we stayed in which was the Queen suite. The internet said on a few places that this hotel had a pool but as you will see from my picture, it is used as a ash trey. If you are a homaphobe, you might not like the location of this hotel. It is in a "gay" section of town. It is right in the heart of everything. You might not want to stay here if you want to walk to the main tourist attractions like Stanley Park, ect. Those places are a bit far but EVERYTHING else is right there. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. I am only posting just a few of the pictures of the hotel that we took. Wouldn't want to bore you.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice amenities, great location”
Reviews.Author: Love2vacation
Reviews.Content: Great location in Vancouver! Also friendly and knowledgeable staff. Clean rooms, balconies, nice to have a kitchen complete with DW, interesting LG combo washer/dryer (takes 286 minutes to complete a very small load!). All the amenities of home. Valet parking for the same price as self parking--very handy! The rates are very reasonable. We managed to get a Bed and Breakfast rate for the same as the regular rate--breakfast at Moxies was quite nice. On the same block are a Starbucks, good Greek restaurant, fruit/veggie store, bakery, etc... Walking distance to water taxi to Granville Island, as well as Robson, the waterfront walking path. Only drawback, if this matters, was the VERY FIRM mattress. All in all a good choice when staying in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, again! Excellent Spa.”
Reviews.Author: cigal
Reviews.Content: Back from my 4th visit since January 2005. Stayed a week and you can't beat the Sandman Suites on Davie for convenience of in-suite laundry, full kitchen including dishwasher, and staff that are attentive and professional. The front desk can get busy at times, so allow some extra time if you know you might be in a rush. The elevators can be slow. Room service from the adjoining Moxie's Grill has good food, fast delivery and friendly service. The room service menu prices are on par with Copeland's, Bennigan's, TGI Friday's, Cactus Club, or Earl's. And when finished you can run the dishes through the dishwasher...how convenient! Great 'four-peat' stay and I recommend it for location, convenience, amenities, and price. The completion of the 3rd floor renovations include the top-notch Phresh Spa which may soon elevate this property into a higher room rate bracket in Vancouver. Visit while this is still the best deal in the WestEnd and Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed for 5 nights at the Sandman Suites on Davie in Feb 06. It was like a home away from home with all the facilities needed for a family with young children. 2 tvs, (one for the kids) full kitchen, and very handy a washer/dryer combination in the room in a concealed laundry. The position was great with a short walk to Stanley Park (for exercise) and Robson St (for shopping). Lots of supermarkets, fruits stores and liquor store within a 5 minute walk. The staff were great, with a 24 hr desk and room service there was always help at hand. The views over the city and mountains behind were spectacular. For the price it was one of the best value hotels we have stayed in. We wouldn't hesitate to stay there again next time we visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jane1981
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Sandman Suites on Davie Street for 2 weeks and I really enjoyed it. The staff were very friendly and helped with any problem we had. The room was very clean and spacious and it was brilliant to have a washing machine in the room. Moxie's grill is the restaurant attached to the hotel and their food is very reasonably priced and very good. The location on Davie Street is very central - only 5 minutes walk to the main shops on Robson Street or 5 minutes in the other direction to English Bay. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great suite”
Reviews.Author: Shelley738
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight at the Sandman Suites on Mar 9/06 and loved the room, the view, the location and the staff. Although tiny, the suite had everything, including a washer/dryer, dishwasher, microwave, fridge and stove. Staff were friendly and accomodating, and there is a restaurant on site, with hundreds of other food, coffee and restaurant choices within blocks. I was on the 23 floor and enjoyed spectacular views of English Bay & the North Shore. Would stay again anytime. Also check out the Phresh Spa on the 3rd floor if you get a chance, I enjoyed the best facial of my life there before heading home. Just a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: Stegotc
Reviews.Content: Spent 14 nights at The Sandman in Davie Village and could not fault it. Clean, spacious well equipped suite. Magnificent views. All staff pleasant and helpful. In a very handy location, frequent buses into City Centre and down to English Bay. All the shops we needed within striking distance and what must be the best organic market and fresh home bakery in the same block as the hotel. We would make this hotel our first choice when we return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price for location and quality!”
Reviews.Author: Tyler_R
Reviews.Content: I really think the other reviews are being very unfair to this hotel. Sure, it's an old hotel that was recently renovated and it isn't a 4- or 5-star, but if you're looking for that go stay at the Westin Grand and pay $200+ a night. The Sandman Suites on Davie is a steal when you book rooms on their web site (my most recent stay was < $100/night!) It's hard to find anything decent in downtown Vancouver at that price, let alone a suite in a newly renovated hotel. (And parking is 1/2 the price of other hotels, too!) If you're price conscious, I highly recommend this hotel. If you're not price conscious, choose the Westin Grand or Sheraton Wall Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Horrible”
Reviews.Author: HeatherSanDiego_CA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sandman in early November, expecting a nice stay based on previous TripAdvisor reviews. I'm sorry to say we experienced quite the opposite. I was stunned to reread these reviews based on the same hotel. I used TripAdvisor all the time for hotel referrals, and I've never been as shocked as I was with the Sandman. I have written a letter to Sandman requesting a refund on our room. Here are some of the excerpts from the letter: Heating. Our suite was absolutely freezing. We turned the heat up as high as possible, and while the bedroom (where the heater was located) stayed warm, the rest of the unit remained ice cold. There was a small vent, approximately 6” x 6”, from that heater that was supposed to warm the rest of the accommodation (see attached picture). It did not. We called the manager who told us there was nothing she could do except send up a space heater. An hour later our space heater arrived, broken and delivering cold air. We let it run for 45 minutes, waiting for it to “heat up”; it never did. The hallway outside our room remained at least 10 degrees (F) warmer than our room. To make things even worse, the heater in the bedroom sounded like a jet engine taking off every time it turned on. Bathtub. I ran the water in our bathtub, and dirty water came out. I wasn’t alarmed because soon after clear water appeared. I then turned off the water and ran it again to clean the dirt from the tub. However, then a MUCH larger amount of dirt came out of the faucet. It was absolutely disgusting. We continued to clean out the dirt and run the bath, and as we did, the faucet fixture fell apart. Big surprise. General appearance of room, furniture and fixtures. The rest of room was in poor shape, as can be seen by the other pictures. The desk was completely discolored and the blinds didn’t even close properly, adding to the poor heating problem. If you want a halfway decent hotel room, even for a night, I highly recommend you find somewhere else to stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Namalee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights and had a great time. The staff on reception were always friendly and helpful (although I agree with one review that they could improve their knowledge of tourist activities in the Greater Vancouver area - but that's a minor point). My room in the hotel was great (although I didn't get a room with a view - only the 5th floor). I loved the fact that it had a washing machine in it and the separate lounge and bedroom was also quite pleasant - made it feel a bit more like a home away from home than a normal hotel room. The bed was almost a little too big for the bedroom! There was heaps of storage space (if you needed it). The kitchen was equipped with a dishwasher and a microwave. The free internet access is also great - there are only two terminals, but there was only one time when I wanted access and both terminals were occupied. The location is great. As with a previous reviewer, I didn't really get the gay vibe, but the hotel is surrounded by really good restaurants (esp if you like Greek food) and if you don't want to go too far, there is a restaurant/bar attached (Moxies) which serves great food (I think Moxies does the room service food as well, but i'm not sure). There are some 'panhandlers' around, but no one was intimidating or threatening and I felt safe at all times(and I was a female travelling alone). The hotel is only a short walk from the main shopping area, as well as Stanley Park. And if you want to take a bus, there is that option as well. I'd definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again if I went to Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “Sandman a value for Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: DizzEDenver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sandman on Davie for 2 nights and it was our favorite hotel of the 2 we stayed at in Vancouver and 1 in Victoria. Vancouver hotels are relatively expensive for a U.S. traveler, and we found the Sandman a good value for being a suite in a happening part of town. You have great access from there to many cool tourist areas of the city. Didn't have much interaction with the hotel staff, so can't comment much on that (perhaps because everything was taken care of?). They did let us check in early and held our bags for a short time after we checked out. The Sandman is in the gay district and my traveling companion and I are not gay, but that part of the city hosts a lot of cool bars and coffee shops and has lower crime than other parts. We thought the styling of the rooms and lobby was really cool. Good views from the balcony. Moxies bar (connected to the lobby) was impressive. Even the bathrooms in there are great (flat screen TV's, fireplaces, plants, etc). The bar staff was above and beyond friendly. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel to other mid to late 20-somethings.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great service”
Reviews.Author: dellacat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the end of a long tour of Canada so choose it as it was a suite and allowed us to cook after eating out for 3 weeks. We got a suite on the 23rd floor which allowed a view of the Vancouver harbour area and mountains which was beautiful. The suite was very well equipped, it even included a washing machine which was a blessing for us rapidly running out of clean clothes. Everything was within walking distance that we wanted to see too. The reception is very trendy looking and the staff were very helpful. This hotel allowed for a very nice end to a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping Well”
Reviews.Author: guyinca
Reviews.Content: In sum, I would state that this hotel is a great value for the money. The views are just terrific, the beds quite comfortable, and the handiness of the kitchen super convenient. The location is superb. We stayed there for a week. The original room we were assigned was not satisfactory as it didn't seem to have been well-cleaned and the furniture was scuffed badly. I spoke to the manager, whom I had dealt with directly in making the reservation, and asked him why we did not get a renovated room. He insisted that it had been renovated but had no problem assigning us to another room, which was the same design, but cleaner and less scuffed up. It worked just fine for us. At $145 CDN a night, we really did not expect more. There are only two computers in the business room and they were often taken, but there are several internet cafes on the street with high-speed connections and rates as low as $2 an hour. Parking was convenient with space always available. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun with fire alarms, dirty sheets and cotton swabs!”
Reviews.Author: grace0418
Reviews.Content: Well, this is a mixed review. I apologize for it's length but I want future guests to know what is in store for them should they decide to stay here. I read the reviews before I went and thought the bad reviews were just being picky and, not being a particularly picky person, I figured I'd be fine. And for the most part, I was. There were just a few problems that I think need to be addressed. First of all the good stuff. The location is great if you're a city person who likes staying in a real neighborhood as opposed to a tourist-only area. The West End has a real pulse and we had a blast. Although I imagine folks not used to an urban and open-minded environment might find the area a bit eye-opening, we're Chicagoans and we loved it. The rooms are also great. I loved the kitchen and the washer/dryer as well as the balcony. I was a little surprised that a room so recently rehabbed would have peeling wallpaper and a toilet not fully attached to the floor, but otherwise I loved the amenities and the space. It's so nice to have a suite with something besides a bed to sit on, it's so much comfier. I didn't think there was an issue with the size of the room at all. Okay, and now for the bad... Cleanliness. Big issue. When we arrived late on Saturday night, exhausted from a long drive, all we wanted to do was make our plans for the next day and go to sleep. The first thing we noticed was some previous guest's used q-tip on the top of the refrigerator. Yuck. Then, as I was getting into bed, I pulled the comforter back to reveal pillows with someone else's hair on them and sheets that looked suspiciously rumpled, as if they hadn't been changed since the last guest. My revulsion was offset by my exhaustion so I slept on the bed anyway, but it was not pleasant. Then next morning I went down to the front desk to ask that our room be thoroughly cleaned while we were out and to inquire how to locate the high-speed internet connection in our room. We had read, direct from the hotel manager's response to an earlier review, that high-speed internet access was going to be standard in every room by the end of March. Here is a direct quote from his response: "We are currently installing full high speed internet access into our guest rooms. This installation will be completed by March 31, 2005." Based on this, we decided to bring our laptop with us on the trip to help us plan our daily activities and keep in touch with our family and housesitter. Well, the two gentlemen behind the desk were apologetic about the room but looked at me like I was crazy when I asked about the internet connection. They said that there were modems available for rent ($5 a day) but other than that the only place with an internet connection was the "business center," a stifling hot room about 6'x10' with two computers and one extra line that was in continual use. The gentlemen at the front desk were kind enough to waive the fee on the modem since we'd had problems with our room and had one sent up to us. Sounds great right? Well, the modem was completely useless. The connection speed was so slow we couldn't so much as check our email much less visit any sites with images. So we lugged our laptop to Vancouver for no reason, as we only managed to quickly check our email twice the whole week. The rest of the time the business center was in use. Naturally I couldn't get on tripadvisor the whole time so I wasn't able to verify what I'd read about internet access in the rooms until we got home. Which reminds me of another problem, the room had no booklet or binder with the amenities and other information listed. I thought that was pretty standard in most hotels, am I mistaken? But let me go back to the cleanliness issue. As I said, I'd asked them to make sure our room was cleaned thoroughly and our sheets changed, as well as the q-tip removed while we were out. We left for over four hours and the room was not cleaned. I gave them the benefit of the doubt because we had returned a little earlier than expected to have a nap, but I asked the front desk as we left that afternoon to make sure it was done when we returned. The woman assured me that, even if a thorough cleaning couldn't be arranged that late in the day, at the very least the sheets would be changed and the garbage removed. When we returned that night, the sheets had indeed been changed but the q-tip remained on top of the refrigerator. In fact, it was there for the remainder of our stay, even though I asked a THIRD time to make sure our room was properly cleaned. Yes, we could've thrown it out ourselves, I realize that. But it was a matter of principle. I felt if something that obvious was overlooked, perhaps other things were overlooked as well, like the cleanliness of the toilet or the dishes in the room. In fact, although everyone we met on the staff was exceedingly friendly, I would say a big issue was lack of attention to responsibilities, large and small. For instance, when we arrived we asked where we could park our car. We knew that we had to pay for parking and were prepared to do so, but were surprised when the woman gave us only one option for parking-- the hotel's valet. So for our entire stay we had to deal with waiting for the valet to get our car, tipping the valet each time, having to clean out our car each day because we couldn't go back out to get anything out of it, AND paying a hefty daily fee for the "privilege" of this service. It wasn't until the night before we left that we found out from another guest that the hotel also had a paid parking lot that allowed the guests to park the car themselves without having to deal with the hassle of a valet. We were so frustrated when we found this out because we never asked for a valet, it was forced on us. Not only that, one time the valet lost our little valet ticket somewhere in the 5 minutes it took him to get our car. He promised he'd drop it off at the front desk but, sure enough, nobody knew anything about it when we inquired later that day. So then we had to go through a 15 minute hassle of explaining to 3 different people what had happened so we could get a new valet ticket for the car. Other small annoyances happened, like requested items being promised but never arriving, "clean" towels with long hairs on them, and no one answering the phone when we called the front desk, but one very large problem and potentially hazardous situation happened late one night. At about 2:00 am, we awoke to the sound of the fire alarm. Very scary. We threw on our clothes and scrambled down 15 flights of stairs to get outside. Unfortunately, the stairwell we descended opened up to the parking garage (the one my husband and I never were given the option to use). This was troublesome to me because the only way out of this garage was a large metal automatic gate. What if the power was out? Would we have been trapped behind that gate? Fortunately the power was still on so we were able to trip the gate mechanism and head outside, but that was still a scary thought. When we got outside, I realized something else quite troubling. There were plenty of guests waiting outside but never once did I see any member of the staff. When it was finally determined to be a false alarm, we heard the news from another guest who asked a fireman. When we returned to the lobby to make our way back up to our rooms, still no staff anywhere that I could see. I don't know exactly what responsibilities a hotel staff has in the case of an emergency, but I would've thought that someone would be directing guests and generally handling the problem. The next day we received an note apologizing for the false alarm from the hotel manager, which was nice but in some ways unnecessary. False alarms happen and can't be helped and I certainly prefer a false alarm over a real emergency! But the real and potentially dangerous problem, a staff perhaps not properly equipped to handle an emergency, wasn't addressed by the manager and really should be.

Reviews.Title: “Great with only one complaint”
Reviews.Author: killiegcm
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sandman for 5 nights and 3 nights before and after our tour of the Rockies. On both occasions we stayed on the 20th floor, both rooms being spacious and well equipped. The rooms were always spotless, with plenty of clean towels. My thanks to all the staff at the reception desk who could not have been more helpful. The added addition of access to the internet to send and receive emails was another bonus. Davies Street as others have said is "colourful" but adds to the enjoyment of the stay. The hotel is a short walk to English Bay, Granville Island (with ferry), Stanley Park and all the shopping in Downtown Vancouver. My only complaint which should be resolved in a few months, is that when we stayed the swimming pool was out of action, it would have been nice to cool off after a day wandering around Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “A gay old time”
Reviews.Author: Haile
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels we have stayed in, friendly staff and friendly customers, though not a hotel for homophobes given as being in the middle of the gay district of Vancouver it attracts a certain type of clientele (my girlfriend and I included). The washer/dryer was great, allowing us to travel with a lot less clothes than normal and more space for shopping and presents. In most aspects this was a home from home, and better to go back to than your normal hotel room. great for shops, restaurants and nightlife, with the beach at the bottom of the hill, we couldn't have asked for a better location. For food try moxies grill in the hotel, Hamburger marys just down the road, Kams place with its Yoda-esque owner, and don't miss the Mongolian BBQ across the road cheap and cheerful. bad points are the lack of a decent TV channel (please get the BBC), and the refrigeration units on top of the restaurants are a little noisy, but in a city thats to be expected. Definitley worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Don't know why hotel isn't rated higher here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed 3 nights in Oceanview Queen Suite (22nd floor) which was immaculate (kitchen was spotless) and new with plenty of room. Outside balcony offered nice harbor view with city view (from our side of the hotel) beautifull when lit up at night. Good location on Davie street close to many different stores/markets/bakeries/restaurants/bars. At the front desk Mimi offered good touring advice and quickly made arrangements for us when requested. The restaurants and bars we spent time at the end of our day on Davie St close to the hotel offered friendly people and wonderful service. Vancouver is such a dynamic city - hated to leave! Charles & Sue

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: alron
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights at Sandman Suites on Davie. The rooms there are clean and well equipped with new appliances- fridge,stove,dishwasher and washer/dryer combo which looked a little complicated at first but was easy to figure out. The view was not great but the location was excellent for us, we walked all over downtown Vancouver and spent a day in Stanley Park. The staff were friendly and helpful. No complaints, would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pimptacular”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay was a positive experience. We paid a little and got a lot. We had a stove, fridge, washer dryer, cable, microwave - all the essentials for an amazing price. Staff were good and very courteous. Elevators were slow, but had no problem getting to places on time. Previous reviews were over reacting and exaggerated to a minor problem. Very close to all the alternative life style clubs - what a rocking good time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful! Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very small. No in-room internet access. I was very surprised by this. They have a business center and will let you use their PC for 30 minutes. I was in there for 5 minutes and when the shift changed the next guy on staff came in yelling at me and wanted to know how long I had been on the PC and WHO let me in there without signing the book! It was the manager who let me in because I was checking the airline for my lost luggage. This alone will keep me from EVER going back! No resturaunt. Clothes got "locked" in the dryer and the manager had to call the company and get a bunch of codes to punch in to get our clothing out. With all of this they have the NERVE to charge for parking??? I recently stayed in a suite that was $69 a night and got free breakfast AND free parking! Housekeeping personel were lovely from the supervisor all the way down. They were all so sweet and the only thing that made our stay tolerable. Most of the staff was very friendly except for the one character that ruined my trip by humiliating me in the business room. But the few friendly people who worked there do not make up for 1. No Internet 2. No free parking 3. No breakfast 4. Tiny rooms 5. Rude staff I have never written a review before but this one deserved it!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Sandman Suites Vancouver on Davie
HotelInfo.Address: 1160 Davie Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V6E 1N1, Canada
